description:
As long as you can get a hold of them.... 
Hands down the best pizza in the entire Bay.
In the immortal words of Weird Al Yankovic...
EAT IT!
author: Nicholas B.

description:
I booked a reservation for 20 at Bravos pizza Memorial Day weekend. I knew parking was going to be hard so I arrived early which made things easier. I had never ate here before but my family had. 
The prices were very reasonable . We ordered wings which were amazing & xl pizzas of all different types. 
We are big eaters/people but our appetite was fully satisfied. The xl are slices are huge . Pizza was not greasy either which is our preference. 

If you want a fancy place where you will pay $50 and up for a large/xl but actually get a medium then this isn't your place. But if you want filling great tasting reasonable price pizza with great staff and a chill atmosphere then this is where you want to go. 
If your bothered by traffic or scare easily from your average weirdos then stay in your comfort zone but if you live life fully and want to taste amazing pizza then Bravo pizza is the place.
author: Rita C.

description:
We felt super lazy on a Saturday night in and Bravo was one of the very few places with good reviews that delivered to our area. We ordered a medium pizza - half #1 bravo's special and half pepperoni, sausage and pineapple. 

The pizza was delivered in about 45 minutes, which was nice - I was expecting longer. We didn't receive any Parmesan cheese/red pepper or utensils so that was a bummer :/ I was super excited for the pizza, but I was not very impressed and it didn't satisfy my cravings :( I like cheese, but the pizza was way too cheesy and not saucy or flavorful enough. The pizza wasn't horrible, but it was just too cheesy and not saucy enough for my liking. If you like cheese, this is the spot for you, but unfortunately, I will probably not order from here again.
author: Bailey L.

description: I've eaten here multiple times and I usually don't do that unless I think a place is off the wall good. Whenever my friends come to visit sf I make sure they try this place. The boss pasta is one of the most simplest yet most amazing pastas here. They have a secret ingredient that they use to make it taste so good but you might be able to figure it out. Even if you do figure it out you'll still probably end up coming here for their pasta and huge serving sizes as I have many times.
author: Navdeep D.

description: Great food. Been around since I used to go out late night and get that craving for pizza. Used to be the place to be.
author: Lisa F.

description: Really good cheesy pizza. Very filling. Their ranch is the best and the family salad is hard to pass up too.
author: EV H.

description: It's been our favorite family pizza place for years ever since we were little! And now I've been bringing my kid  and he loves it too! It's our excuse for coming to the city and we live in Richmond! Yes it's that good!
author: Delmy A.

description: Always come for the bravo pizza. Is super delicious. The price and potion are good. My favorite the New York steak and of course the Bravo Pizza. The service is pleasant and very friendly.
author: Carmen L.

description: Pizza was good, it was just a little bit of slow service and poor attention to customer. Also the bar area it's in doesn't make it better. Next time we'll order take out...
author: Brenda M.

description: Love this pizza spot, one of the best in town forsure. They give you a family feel and always make sure the customer is satisfied
author: Alli B.

description: BEST PIZZA IN THE WHOLE BAY AREA!! My curious son seen pizza dough on the counter and touched it with his finger. The owner then, cut that piece off and handed it to my son so he can be entertained for a while. Very nice gesture. I love getting sausauge pepperoni pizza and having sautéed mushrooms covered with it. So yummy!!
author: Wendy F.

description: This pizza place came highly recommended, and after our first visit, I can see why. From the outside, the place isn't much, in fact it's almost easy to miss. Just a little hole in the wall place, but their pizza is amazing! Parking is going to be tricky, just forewarning! We went in for an early dinner on a Sunday evening and were seated right away. Our waitress was extremely nice and made sure we had everything we wanted or needed. My husband was happy with the selection of beer on tap. I had a coke and it was bubbly and sweet just like it should be. We ordered a large almost everything and in minutes it arrived hot and delicious. We ordered a side of ranch, and they bring out a full bowl of homemade ranch, super delicious. This is our new spot. We live on the other side of the bridge and are willing to drive 40 minutes for this pizza! This place treats you like family!
author: Sarah P.

description: Hands down the best pizza ever!!! Been getting this since I was a kid. I moved to Sacramento and there's no place out here like it. I wish they had a Bravo in Sac.
author: May D.

description: We eat in here about once a month. I love these people, and I really like their food. The wait staff is really friendly to us and our daughter, and make us feel so welcomed. Wonderful neighborhood spot.
author: Spencer W.

description: Absolutely the best pizza in the Bay Area! I treated my granddaughters to some REAL pizza. They both loved it!
author: Lo L.

description: Pretty much grew up eating at Bravos, moved to the East Bay & still always was and is our go to spot in SF. Fast forward to 20 yrs later and now i share this memory with my kids. The pizza and any dish you order is amazing
author: Dc P.

description: The pizza is alright. Super disappointed with the wings I received. They were charcoal black.  They didn't taste good at all
author: Daniella S.

description: 37 years old and still have not found a better pizza!!!!!!! Me and my family have been coming here since I can remember, now that we live on the other side of the Bay we make it a habit to come to Bravosa few times a month.... The little hidden gem is a must for any pizza lover
author: Eddie P.

description: Love this place ! It's always great every time, great pizza, great pasta, great ranch, service is great. My favorite pizza in the whole city. Sometimes it's hard to get a hold of them ok the phone but they are that bussy ...
author: Karen P.

description: LOVE LOVE LOVE BRAVOS!! This has been the pizza spot since I was a little girl and till this day it's still the best pizza spot to me and my family. Can't go wrong with Bravos!!
author: Monique C.

description:
Great Pizza, Great Service. Always will travel for their food! 

My only issue is I wish they'd upgrade and renovate the establishment.
author: Niema A.

description: Great pizza and good people been coming here for years along with many of my family members
author: Ricardo R.

description: Bravo.. we love u... the Hawaiian pizza is the best. Been ordering from this location for over 10+ yrs. service and delivery has not disappointed us.
author: Jennie C.

description: I had ordered bravo pizza. That included mushroom, onion, pepporoni, and lots of cheese. It s better than ordering Domino definitely
author: Jeongeun K.

description: Family run pizza place. Very classic feel. Great pizza and wings. Laguna's draft. Friendly service for eat in, and fast call-in delivery.
author: Shane R.

description: Great food they serve you in big portions so COME hungry!! Friendly service  parking well you have to circle a few times to get a spot, but it's worth it!
author: Lilly O.

description: The pizza is ok. It's not as thick as I remembered it was. I ordered the combination pizza and it was kind of burnt. I don't know but Bravo Pizza was always delicious now it's just Ok. Sorry but I'm just being honest.
author: Benito R.

description: Fairly good pizza but horrible horrible customer service. The jerk who took my order over the phone actually accuse me of misunderstanding him that I ordered a side of ranch dressing but no salad? Didn't have the decency to apologize that he made a mistake. Not the first time they get orders  wrong.  There are way too many good pizza places in San Francisco to bother with this sleazy rude bunch. Thanks
author: Liliana M.

description: One of my favorite places to get pizza from. Bravos never fails to serve high quality pizza. A good variety of toppings, and their crust is relatively thin. Pricing is not too bad considering its location. The atmosphere is like any pizzeria with sports showing on the television monitors. Highly recommended if you're in the Excelsior district.
author: John M.

description: I called to order pizza for carryout at 7:30 and they answered the phone on the first ring.  The guy was nice and said it would be 30 minutes.  We got there at 25 minutes and it was ready.  There was plenty of cheese and toppings.  I ordered fresh garlic and there was a lot of it, which I loved.  It was on the saltier side, but we like it like that.  Not the best pizza of my life, but very good and will definitely get it again.
author: Lisa R.

description: Love eating here at bravo good pizza good service ... been eating for many years watching football games on Sunday... Pete is a ok guy sometimes...Especially on his day off lol.....
author: Frankie L.

description: I am born and raised in San Francisco and have been eating at Bravos my whole life! Our family has always ordered XL pepperoni, mushroom, and sausage pizza! Its the best! We sometimes get a salad or sauteed mushrooms on the side and those are also delicious! We moved out to the east bay and most of the family drives in to the city atleast one Friday a month to eat Bravos! This is real San Francisco pizza.
author: Ricardo R.

description:
Love it ! love it! Love it!!
Best SF pizza!!
Hole in the walk, restaurant definitely needs remodeling however their pizza is the best!!!
author: Nancy A.

description:
This is my local and favorite pizza place no matter where I am in the city my only complaint is for the young feminine sounding dude who occasionally answers the phone and has no customer service and has the rudest voice when taking orders or even taking down credit card payment. You don't want to lose faithful customers over some guy who sounds annoyed to be at work. 

Other than that my family has been eating here since we lived in the Geneva Towers.
author: Elle E.

description: Best pizza place ever and very good service I love this place and come here every chance I get
author: Thomas G.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!

Been eating Pizza at Bravos since I was a kid. I take my Daughter there now & she loves there pizza too. It's an old school pizza parlor. No fancy wine list or foo foo pizza just delicious thick crust pizza.
author: Luis M.

description: Mediocre pizza at best. I do really like the cheese they use. Delivery lags but in the outer mission theirs only a few options
author: Michael W.

description: Best pizza in the world bruh ahahahhahahhahahahaa. Besst pizaaaa in the world it is number one Nd always will be
author: Perla V.

description:
Pizza is good. Salad is good. Everything else not so much.But then again people come here for the pizza right.

Games are usually on multiple TVs. Service is pretty good. Nice family atmosphere.
author: Marvin R.

description:
Great old school pizza parlor that has been there for a long time with red booth seats in the somewhat darkly lit restaurant. I went on Saturday afternoon. So many times I would drive by the Mission and Geneva intersection and bypass this pizza joint. They don't have any printed to go menu, so I just took photos of menu. I saw the pizza being made and put in the oven. There were a family and solo diner eating inside. There seemed to be a lot of to go orders.

Impressive pizza that is not oily! That's 5 stars in my foodie book! Good ingredients and crust. Will surely come back and try their other pizzas! Yummy in my tummy! :-)
author: Priscilla L.

description: I've been coming here for years. I've always advocated for bravos and referred friends but recently have been treated like a second class human when trying trying to redeem the free pizza while still buying 2 pizzas with the order. I'm not some mooch but I thought buy 10 pizzas get one free was a cool perk for loyal customers such as myself. But with president trump in office things have changed everywhere including here at bravos. I was told I'd be better off getting tacos than ordering a pizza from their establishment. So I just want to say screw you bravos.
author: Evert M.

description: Best fucking pizza in SF. Yes the dough is thick, yes there are fat ass pineapple chunks. It's literally my dream pizza. They have the best homemade ranch which I cannot live without. I always order delivery or takeout. Yes this place has roaches. I've literally seen them climbing up the walk when dining in. I could literally care less though because the pizza is just that bomb.
author: Annette B.

description: Very greasy but still a pretty good pizza located in excelsior. Never dined there only did take out.  Been around a long time..
author: Mark P.

description: The pizza here is good. This review is actually for their dinner salad which I love. Anywhere else in the city it would be called a wedge salad and it would cost twice as much. Plus, at bravo they even cut your wedge for you!  So it's basically iceberg, garbanzo beans, red onions, tomatoes and a couple of slices of pepperoni and if you're me you have to get the insanely good blue cheese dressing. Dinner. Done. $4. Plus. Homemade bread that toasts up the next morning brilliantly with butter and jam.
author: S Blair P.

description:
Writing this review regarding the pickup of food that my daughter brought to my place for dinner.  I do have to say B-R-A-V-O and a five star.  We had a pepperoni pizza which was thick crust.  Our main pizza was with grilled red onions, sausage, a lot of garlic and thick crust.  The pizza was really delicious.  I even ate it cold the next morning for breakfast.

My daughter did mention to the manager that I enjoyed their homemade bread because it tasted like the bread my mom and sister made like over forty years ago when I lived at home.  He was so gracious as to insert a free loaf of bread for me in the order.  As stuffed as we were my daughter and I ate a hot slice of bread with butter.  You have no idea how happy it made me.

Next time I have Bravo's, I plan on dining in their restaurant so I can personally thank the manager for the bread.
author: Karen B.

description: $25 for a large, but at least they gave us 3 free can Sodas. My problem was with the taste and quality of the pizza. It was pretty bland, no real taste, or personality to the pizza. It's getting harder and harder to find some decent pizza delivery in the city. At the very least this pizza wasn't greasy like most. I think the main issue was the quality and taste of the pizza sauce. The sauce was terrible and did not mesh well with the crust and cheese. The crust was overwhelming. I usually love the crust, but this one was just too much to finish. Bravo I was deeply disappointed and I won't be getting any delivery anytime soon. Work on that sauce!
author: J M.

description: I used to come here when I was a kid and they used to be good. Stopped coming because the quality of their food went way down. Recently people have commented that they have gotten better again so I decided to try them and say what the hell. This place has NOT gotten any better. The crust was burnt, yet the dough was very undercooked. I don't know how that happens but wow! Not ordering from them again. Medium pie cost $25 and so not worth it. Should have saved my money and went to little Ceasar's for better quality.
author: Boris G.

description: Very tasty, huge slices, and totally worth the price. We ordered delivery on a Saturday night, and it arrived within an hour. They even threw in a few coca-cola cans. Definitely will order again :)
author: Nancy R.

description: We've been eating here at bravos for years this place is the best, the best. I had to say it twice because the service here is always great thank you Bravo.
author: Darlene M.

description: Pizza is always delicious and they deliver quickly! When u have the munchies and I want quality pizza I call Bravos!
author: Tha C.

description: Love at First bite!  My Family & I LOVE BROVO'S been coming to This establishment since the 70's And it has only gotten better! Pete & the staff are now part of our growing family!
author: Lisi P.

description: Went to a concert and had to have bravos after! Had the pesto and added chicken! The pizza was really good but I have to say in the morning,that day after pizza was BOMB! Plus you don't have to worry about a soda you get a free one or two depending on the size pizza you get!!
author: Xia C.

description:
Pizza dough way too thick. I feel like I ordered crust only and a ton of cheese. 

My delivery was a sausage mushroom pizza.

Round table down the street to me is even better then what I got tonight and they put a bigger proportion of toppings  :( shame wish I got a win I combo now lol 

It's not that it's nasty or anything, but I ordered a sausage mushroom pizza and all I taste is cheese and dough when I take a bite. 

Maybe other people like this but to me this is not good pizza :P the wings were ok though. 

Maybe I'll try a pasta or something next time
author: China D.

description: I haven't had pizza from this place in about a year. I placed an order tonight and it really did not taste like it use to. I ordered a medium pepperoni and pineapple. I feel as though they got really lazy, the pineapple is in a full ring on top of each slice like they literally just took it out of a can and threw it all over the pizza. Not sure if this is how they do it now but it has always been diced into smaller pieces. This is more of a pineapple pizza. The pepperoni is burnt so its really dry, I also asked for thin crust and this is supper thick. Don't think i will be ordering from this place anymore.
author: Natasha A.

description: Hands down the best pizza in San Francisco. This pizzeria is a cornerstone of the city and if you are a transplant, tourist, local, or anyone in SF you need to have some Bravo Pizza at least one time in your life. Pete has built a community around his business welcoming everyone with open arms. Best Pizza around thanks for being amazing
author: Ryan G.

description:
Me and my family Have been coming here for years, pizza is really good usually! Ordered a pizza recently and it was disgusting! The pizza had so many onions that I had to literally pick them off! Not only the excessive amount of onions but the pizza was so doughy it was was not cooked well! I had called and spoke to the manager which he was so damn rude, he acted like I was trying to get over on him! I have spent so much money there, and just this night over $40.00!
He gave me a small credit towards another pizza which is okay but I think he should have been decent enough to give me another pizza no charge. Anyway this is the guy who answers the phone there most of the time, he's always rude he sounds like he hates his job! I have already. complained about this guy a few times and they said they will work on it!!! It seemshe doesn't like working with people which in my eyes he should not work there! Unfortunately I have been unhappy quite a few times with the attitude which makes me not want to call there!!! I just want to order a cooked pizza not an uncomfortable attitude pleaseeeeeeee!!! Looks like I won't be your customer anymore Bravo!!! Too bad
author: Susie C.

description:
I love pizza and this was most likely the worst pizza I've ever had. Ordered 3 XLs for delivery (the #1, #2, and chicken/mushroom). Definitely not cheap at $98, which also included 9 cans of coke thrown in. The weight of each pizza is pretty substantial.

However, there were 2 major issues with the pizzas: 
1) Way too much dough. No one in our party even attempted to eat the crust as it was too overwhelming and not tasty enough to waste stomach capacity on.
2) We could not hold a slice as it was too soggy. It was so soggy it completely soaked the paper under the pizza, causing it to stick to the dough and almost impossible to separate from one another. I had to use a spatula to scoop a slice onto a plate and then use a knife and fork to eat it. 

There seemed to be a good amount of cheese, which is not bad in my book. But I found myself eating a glob of cheese and meat and then picking up the soggy remains of the dough with a fork. 

If you like doughy, soggy pizza with gobs of cheese, this is a must try.

The only way I would give this place another shot is if it was free, but would still do so reluctantly.
author: Alex C.

description: Some of the best pizza in the bay area, my personal fave in the city. Our family has been customers here since the 70s! Same great service same great pizza. Family friendly and reasonable prices, just gotta black an eye for parking lol
author: Moana T.

description: This is my favorite pizza place in the city, service is always courteous, wether you call to pick up or for delivery, every time We go to dine in with the family or friends, the pizza tastes even better. Great place to have a beer and watch sports too.
author: Juan M.

description: Decided to try this place out... worst decision. The crust was EXTREMELY TOO THICK and probably the worst pizza I ever had. Beware!!!
author: Ajah K.

description:
After an HOUR and FORTY-TWO minutes I had to cancel my order on principle alone. When I placed the order I was NEVER informed of it being a long wait. I wish I had known that bit of info so that I could've told my 10-year old at the time we ordered. 

I called Bravo to inquire about the delay an hour and twenty minutes after ordering. At that time I was told the pizza had already left with the driver and that he likely had a few stops. I was told it "will be there shortly." So 22 more minutes passed and it STILL HADN'T ARRIVED. I figured it's likely cold, been sitting in the trunk of the car, and I was bugged that I hadn't been informed of the looooong wait. I cancelled and called another spot. 

I didn't mind the wait as much if they had been upfront. But, not being upfront and then telling me "it's on its way." wasn't cool. 

Awwww, what happened to the good 'ol days when we had a Toto's in Daly City close to the old Shoe Fair. Sadly it was knocked down and we now have Daly City Century 20.
author: Alex M.

description: It would have been 5 but the crust is a little thick and sometimes the service is slow. Overall great pizza and ranch
author: Kel L.

description:
Literally eating pizza since I was a kid, this is one of my first pizza experiences from my preteen years.  In the 1970's, there weren't many pizza delivery companies around.  Imagine a 13-year old dialing his rotary phone and ordering Italian food delivery.  My older brother certainly didn't mind those numerous shared pizzas that left us wondering, "Did we really eat the WHOLE THING?!"  (reference to Alka Seltzer commercial (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VFKifpMtlNs))
Fast forward forty years later and... oops, did that slip out?
Wanting old fashioned Italian food (no, I haven't tried Capo's yet), I have been ordering here on a regular basis in the past year.  Here's what came:

1) The Big One (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=uNe2TYjsnT3-qFnTrNyRZA&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - The name says it all.  One HUGE box filled with three large meatballs, plenty of spinach and cheese filled ravioli, a pile of spaghetti noodles, drowned in a hearty marinara sauce.  This lasted me three meals.

2) Baked meat lasagna (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=SgjYf1Sjl0gDyOE5f8sDWg&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - My favorite in the City, the portions are enough for two meals.  

Both meals come with a choice of salad or Minestrone soup (a bit on the oily side) and two or three slices of the housed baked bread (perfect for sopping the last drop of sauce).  My delivered order came out to just under $30.00 before tip, reasonable since it lasted me four meals.  If you order delivery, definitely account for the time as they are especially swamped on Friday and Saturday evenings.  
Nodding my head silently.
author: Mike C.

description:
Another one of my old school jaunts. Been coming here since the mid 90's (showing my age...) I can recall a time when you used to be able to come in with a fresh fitted or snap back of any of the local sports teams and trade them for a medium one topping pie. This place has been serving up piping hot pizza's since as long as my family has been in the city. Walk on in and let them know what you are craving and 15-20 minutes later you will be sitting in front of one heck of a pizza. 

They pile on the cheese like the Splash Brothers rain 3's (#DubNation)! The crust is thicker than most pizza joints so some people aren't a fan of it but I know I am!  it's soft and great to dip in the sauce of your choice (nudge, nudge... get the ranch!). They have everything from  Wings to Spaghetti and Meatballs, Ravioli's, Steaks, Pasta's and Salads.

Don't hesitate to give it a whirl, you will be pleasantly surprise on the variety of dishes and pies available. The evil side of your shoulder will thank you as well as your tummy! 

Bravo to you all!
author: Josh H.

description:
Lousy first time experience. 
Called in delivery of a large pepperoni, 8 wings and a family salad at 6:30p on a Sunday night. 7:30p rolls around, no pizza. 
I call the shop: no answer. No problem, I figure they're busy. 
8p rolls around. Where's my order? I call the shop. No answer. I'm looking at Yelp and they're closing by 9p. They wouldn't forget about us would they?
8:30p arrives and I'm like where's my pizza? I call the shop. No answer. I call repeatedly for the next ten minutes. No answer. Well, now I'm hosed. Most other pizza joints are closing soon!
Ok, now it's 8:40p, forget this, I have to go down there and see what's going on. I hop in my car and race to the shop, but I also dial the shop one last time. I put it on speaker and listen to the sweet, sweet sounds of ringing and ringing all the way there. 
I bounce out of my car with my phone still on speaker, still dialing. They're closing up shop and sweeping, clearly ready to call it a night. 
I told them I've been waiting for my pizza since 6:30p, been calling for the last hour with no answer, I even show them my phone THAT IS CALLING THEM RIGHT NOW what's happening!!??
The two guys scramble to figure this out and are perplexed: turns out the delivery guy left with our order a LONG time ago. Well, where is this guy cruising around with our order? As they hustle to figure it out, my wife calls and tells me it finally arrived. 
The dudes at the shop apologize, but I'm like, the heck is going on??
So I go home pretty annoyed, and find the pizza and the wings cold (clearly been cruising around SF for way too long). My wife tells me the driver was apologetic and promised next time would be faster.
But here's the interesting part: the driver's car had an uber sticker. 
Hmmmmm...
Could it be our delivery guy may have been picking up fares too? We really don't live far from the pizza and it did take TWO AND A HALF HOURS to arrive cold. Maybe. 
I called Bravo to complain about my pizza and they apologized again...just kidding, I called and they didn't answer and it just kept ringing and ringing. 
Get. Your. Business. Together.
author: Aldo M.

description: BY. FAR. THE. BEST. PIZZA. I. EVER. HAD. IN. MY. LIFE. I don't mean that lightly. I've traveled a lot for my age and I've done so for school mostly. However, that doesn't mean I didn't enjoy meals from other states (especially PIZZA my fav), but when I came here for the first time I literally felt my taste buds die and go to food heaven. Chicago, New York, Italy, whatever I don't care. This place here in my own backyard has the best pizza I have ever had. Such a nice family vibe in the store itself as well. It was a little cramped for me, but the pizza was WAY too worth it for me. Literally, I had to buy two larges to keep my fix on for it. Oh yeah, did I forget to mention that I'm trying to be a dietitian? That's how good it is! Super yummy I just love the right combination of sauce, cheese, and pepperoni. The right combo of chew and crunch, the ranch, the SF vibe, it was all beyond perfect. I'm definitely coming back here ASAP.
author: Ericka R.

description:
The person who took my call at 5:40 pm, 12/13/15, was incredibly rude. I won't get into the details, but here's an example: after asking me to spell out my street, he repeats it back to me saying "so you mean b as in boy, e as in elephant, l as in loser, l as in loser again..." He repeated this multiple times, was incredibly crass with me, and all I wanted to do was order a pizza from a place a friend recommended. I understand he may have been having a rough day but definitely the worst customer experience I've had and I feel like it was completely uncalled for. 

Will not be ordering from here again. Pizza came two hours later and it was ok.
author: Ghina K.

description: Love the fluffy crust! Pizza is always good and they deliver a free coke with your pizza! Or two! Depending on the size.
author: Patricia S.

description: Always my fave! Our family are customers for 20 plus years. Not sure if they switched owners or what but whoever took over now has it open and closed randomly and online there are conflicting hours. My family and I recently came here from out of town because it said it was open til 10 but when we got there dude said the dining room closed at 8pm so it was take out only and pizza only. It used be open til late and they'd deliver til 3am. Wack!
author: Anna F.

description:
My husband and I decided to order take-out from here on Valentine's Day, so we expected a long wait time and called in our order with the intention of coming in early grabbing a beer as we waited.  

I called in and the person on the phone was super friendly and said our pizza would be ready in 30 minutes, which was fine. We were nearby, so we parked and walked in to pay and check out their beer selection. I think they thought we were trying to rush them and were a tad bit defensive when we told them who we were, but they made up for it later. 

I didn't care for the beer selection, and didn't see an open seat anyway, so we payed and went to a bar nearby for 30 minutes. Upon return our pizza was ready, although the workers did joke with us that it would be another 45 minutes, and they threw in three or four cokes for free! I was super happy with the service and our pesto pesto pizza! It was to die for and made our laid back Valentines Day awesome! I will be back for sure and will try delivery next time.
author: Steph L.

description:
Brave Pizza is a local establishment that has been around since the 60s. They did change owners at one point but I can't tell if there has been a dip in quality. Some friends and I came in to order a pizza to eat inside. The phone was blowing up with phone orders. A good and bad sign. Good because it shows the place is popular which usually means good food. Bad sign because there is a chance we might have to wait for our pie behind all the delivery/phone orders. 

We were sat in a timely manner and had menus in hand in no time. We had already came in knowing what we wanted so we made the order as soon as we sat. The staff is very down to earth and friendly. If you are there and a guy named Basilios is working, try and get him. Super chill, very attentive and always checking in to see if we needed anything. Good on you sir.

The decor is very divey, but in a good way. The signs are funny, posters of Italy were hanging and the staff is very matter of fact. I don't need any BS, I need it straight up when it comes to my food and Bravo delivers. Bravo guys.
author: Jeromy G.

description:
Very solid pizza! The world famous bravo is DELICIOUS and reheats well. There's something about the onion (in addition to all the other toppings) that just puts the flavor over the top. 

Xlarge cheese pizzas are perfect for parties, and they deliver for about an extra $10. The pizzas also come with cans of coke which was a nice surprise. 

They put coupons on the top of each pizza box so that once you buy 10 you get a free one. Almost there...
author: Steph D.

description:
Just didn't wow me but it was good pizza. Topping weren't scarce but also not stacked. Ordered an extra large half pepperoni and half "Almost Everything". It was a good sized pizza that for me and my fiancee with leftovers of the next day. 
The location isn't very easy to get parking. I just dropped my fiancee off to pick it up as a double parked/looked for parking. They also gave 4 soda cans for free at pick-up, didn't even know till we paid. We appreciated the nice gesture even though we don't regularly drink soda.
author: Earl G.

description: This place has been around since I was a little girl! Everything is still the same, remember coming in with my parents & siblings and now taking my kids here as well. I never thought of rating cause this has always been our family eating place, either dine in or delivery. We never get disappointed especially with the same huge pizza that feeds my family. This is my child hood favorite.
author: Mona Lisa L.

description:
Bravo pizza is this amazing little volunteer pizza restaurant that operates probono. 

Ok so that's not true but i honestly don't know how this place is making any money.  Each time I've come here it's been myself and another very hungry co-diner and we can barely put a dent in an antipasto salad ($9- served in a king-size serving bowl big enough for 6 ppl) and a small pizza. I am not exaggerating people. The small pizza is way too much for two extremely hungry people. 

So if the gigantic portions and tiny prices haven't convinced you, let me talk about the quality. 

H o m e m a d e   B r e a d
They serve fresh out of the oven, homemade bread in a modest basket lined with paper towel. I smelled it and was shocked and asked the server "is this....is this...homemade?!?" Yes. The answer is yes. It's phenomenal. 

I cannot recommend the antipasto salad enough, it has EVERYTHING, beans, salami, ham, cheese, bell peppers, onions, olives, tomatoes and homemade salad dressings! One of my very favorite ranch salad dressings ever! 

The pizzas are so huge and heavy the servers often carry them with two hands! This is a thick crust pizza with tons of cheese, a great tomato sauce not too bitter or sweet, and the perfect amount of toppings. 

This little family owned and operated spot is my new go-to dinner.  For under $30 I can have a plentiful meal for two plus enough leftovers for 4 lunches after. 

Never change, Bravos! You're doing it right!
author: Emma H.

description:
With so many four and five star ratings for Bravo Pizza, I had high hopes for this place. Unfortunately, the two times I've had their pizzas, I was disappointed, but for different reasons.

The first time, I ordered a #3 "Almost Everything" for delivery, which took an outrageous 90 minutes!! Maybe I'm very impatient, but generally 60 minutes is the longest I'd wait for pizza delivery. The "Almost Everything" has pepperoni, salami, sausage, beef, olives, bell peppers, mushrooms, and onions. The pizza was a delicious, cheesy mess that was difficult to enjoy because toppings were so abundant that even the thick dough couldn't hold it all. Bravo's pizzas have a really thick and powdery crust, and the dough is too chewy. Personally, I prefer thin crust pizzas.

The second time, I ordered a #1 "World Famous Bravo" for pick-up, which took a reasonably-timed 25 minutes. The pizza has pepperoni, salami, sausage, mushrooms, onions. There was plenty of pepperoni and sausage, but salami was lacking a bit. The way the salami was layered beneath the cheese made it difficult to judge whether or not they skimped with that delicious nitrate-ridden meat. What's worse was the mushrooms, as if they forgot them! The mushrooms were in tiny pieces, and there wasn't a lot either. I would've felt less insulted if they had just forgotten the mushrooms all together.

The restaurant is small, old, and looks a bit rundown. I believe this a more of a takeout or delivery kind of place. I can't speak for dining in, but when you order for takeout or delivery, you're given complimentary soda (Coca Cola). If I'm craving pizza while in this neighborhood, Bravo's will still be an option, even though there's at least another ten or more pizza places within a mile radius.
author: Priscilla W.

description: Bravo is decent. For me I like it enough to try it once in a while but I'm not going crazy for it (hope that makes sense). Hospitality inside has been great so kudos for that and the pizza dough is good.
author: Justin W.

description: We come here because it's convenient and right down the street from home. It's hit or miss with this place...as of late miss.
author: Vanessa S.

description: No wimpy thin crust or gluten free here. Just good old honest thick crust with lots of gooey cheese. A little skimpy on the toppings but all the cheese makes up for it.
author: Lee U.

description:
We actually dined in this time. This place is dirty. I'm talking about every booth being ripped up leaving pokey plastic on your ass (at least tape them up!), white plates stained with black, my cousins fork had food on it, the parmesan bottle was super greasy and disgusting to the touch, and there was a fly circulating around our food the entire time. 

That being said, the pizza was amazing. We got a large mushroom & pineapple for three people and there was plenty left over. I wish they had more topping options! The menu is hilarious. My cousin said it felt like we had been transported to the middle of no where and it was the only pizza place in a 40 mile radius. There were a ton of people not eating pizza too which I assume means their entree's are just as good. I probably would not dine here again but I will definitely be ordering for delivery.
author: Tiffany V.

description: SF staple- I love Bravo's pizza is perfect combo of nice crusty bread, yummy sauce and fresh ingredients. One of my family's favorite pizza places.
author: Rosa A.

description: A must go to spot if you're in San Francisco! I am a SF native and have been coming here since I was a baby! The food is consistent and never changes menu is always the same and that's what makes this neighborhood pizza joint one of the best's! Best pizza I have had in my life! Thank you BRAVOS for never changing! :)
author: Ricky R.

description:
Best pizzeria that delivers to my neighborhood; they are my number 1 choice. Use to come here since I was a little girl. 

I would stick only to their Pizza, the salads are A-OK too.
author: Corey G.

description: Most delicious pizza in the whole Bay Area! I'd give it 10 stars if I could. The dough is a special kinda perfect, but what makes this place stand out far far above the rest is the people that run it. Pete treats his customers like family. So grateful to feel like a part of the Bravos family every time we come in for a pie!
author: Vanessa L.

description: Grew up eating this place since I was a little boy salad is awesome spaghetti is awesome pizza is awesome everything is awesome there
author: Teddy S.

description: one of the homiest little spots ever& one of the best pizza spots in SF. pizza is extremely cheesy and the bread is not too dry or tough to bite; crispy! my bf and i shared a medium half pepperoni/ half hawaiian and it was more than enough i left 2 slices to take home. friendly service & they accept debit cards!
author: Debbie L.

description: This is usually my go to when ordering pizza when i'm in the area. I have always had great service up until today. I placed a delivery order and Robert was very rude and condescending. I will not be back to spend $20 bucks on a small pizza due to his horrible service.
author: Miss V.

description: Best pizza ever!! Lived all over the world. Let me tell you that this place is the bomb.
author: J B.

description:
Speaking of Bravo, there's a show on that channel, that it seems like all the girls watch.  I always see a Facebook post or conversations about the Real Housewives.  A lot of women watch it, even a couple guys I know that I'll leave nameless for fear their manhood will come into question. 

So apparently this show is about Rich, Collagen filled, dramatic women.  So what does this show on Bravo have to do with Bravo Pizza?  Absolutely nothing.

In fact it's the opposite.  The most friendly group of people work here.  Man sized portions where you are guaranteed to be bringing home leftovers for the next day.  A very comfortable pizza parlor, filled with booths to sit at.  High carb, saturated fat filled, drama free Italian comfort food.

The utility pizza served here has a thicker than usual crust, so if you expect thin crust, you're at the wrong place.  This pizza comes with thick crust, heavy cheese, heavy on the toppings, and a nice sauce.  

What I enjoy more than the pizza is the entrees served at Bravo.  Veal Scaloppini, spaghetti w/meatballs, and my favorite is Chicken Parmigiana.  Entrees served with a side of pasta and salad can be added for a couple dollars more.  

Also I'll order buffalo wings on most occasions.  And fresh house-made bread is served.  All meals are easy on the pocket book as well, usually around $12 a person. 

So when I hear the word Bravo, I don't think of Real Housewives.  I think of real friendly people, real comfort, real pizza, and real good food.  Always leaving me real full and satisfied.
author: Michael L.

description:
Came here because our original destination was a sports bar packed with Giants fan watching the game. I wasn't sure if this place would be crowded as I had never been, so I called ahead to see if there was a wait and got put on hold. A little weird but then the guy came back on the line within a minute and said the location was a first-come-first-serve with currently no wait. After actually coming to the location, I wondered if he put me on hold to laugh.. =/ 

The location is right on the corner of Mission St and Geneva Ave. There's street metered parking that can be sometimes hard to find (depending on the time), or you can go a little further and if you're lucky, find residential parking. Very dive-y feel to the place with very worn booths and dim lighting. My friend's side of the booth was actually sunken in and the upholstery torn up. Can't really expect much from this area though. The menu is catered to serve families as they had lots of options for family sized orders (even a pitcher of soda!). Don't expect to find any fancy menu items here. None of the Spring, Spinach, or Arugula Salad. No Provolone, Brie, or Pepper-jack Cheese. They have bottled beer and a very small selection of cheap wines if you really had to have wine.

Our Order:
Large #3 Almost Everything: ($28.30) Pepperoni, Sausage, Salami, Beef, Olives, Bell peppers, Mushrooms, Onions
Family Sized Salad: ($7.25) Lettuce, tomatoes, beans & salami

The salad came out in a salad bowl topped with large slices of salami. The beans in the salad were garbanzo and kidney beans. Even though not stated on the menu, it also came with thin slices of raw onions and green bell peppers. Options of dressing: Ranch, Italian, Thousand Island or Oil & Vinegar. Not my choice of salad as I'm not a fan Romaine lettuce but that's all they have here.

The large on the menu says it's 16" but when it came out.. OMG it was huge! Looked larger than the 16" that was listed. We had ordered a large because my friend said he was starving (and he's one of those gym rats that eats a lot) but after the pizza came out.. we were pretty sure we weren't going to finish it. In the end, we managed to finish half (which was a major feat) but we also had been talking for over 2 hours so we were munching as we talked. The bottom of the pizza and the crust were crispy but since it is a thick pizza, the center was slightly on the doughy side. Ingredients were ample and the cheese very elastic but soft.

The staff was helpful and constantly checked-in on us. Our waitress was so friendly and had the sweetest smile! It basically felt like we were being taken care of by someone's grandma.
author: Kitty K.

description:
I just called to place an order for delivery , Pete was was really polite and friendly . I feel bad for call when they were about to closed,    First time trying bravo pizzeria 

Thanks for taking my order Pete.  This guy deserves a raise!
author: Edgardo S.

description:
Always so happy with the delicious pizzas and the sautéed mushroom that they have 
Everything are super Perfect cooking and taste amazingly 
I highly recommend this nice Restuarant
author: Mustafa A.

description:
Back in the day(late 80's early 90's), 5 STARS!!! But they've fell off over the years. It may be true what other yelpers are saying; bad customer service, pricey, doughy crust, can sauce, cheap cheese, dirty dining area, and bland/flavorless ingredients, but I can NEVER stop going here. I've become accustomed to their pizza.

I grew up on this pizza, it's a family tradition, and Pete is folks. And leave the waitress alone, lol. She's been there since the 80's, may be even longer. Her customer service skills have definitely declined, but I'm patient with her cause I know the history of the place. I can see how a new customer would be shocked of this restaurant. 

4 STARS, only cause I'm a fan.
author: Tori T.

description: Pete is a great guy and owner. Taking care of us late night and giving us some laughs. Be sure to try their wonderful pizza, thicker crust with layers of great toppings. I love pizza and bravo to this place for making pizza right.
author: Vanessa P.

description:
Don't expect Little Star or Flour and Water. Come here if you want to experience to pizza place of the childhood you wish you had. It obviously has not changed much since before you were likely conceived if you're on yelp. Old school booths, wood everywhere, 9ers and giants, and of course token Italian flag painted brick. 

Pizza was good. Side salad (iceberg, beans, salami) had awesome house ranch that we subsequently dipped crust in. Garlic bread was ehh. 5ish $ for a half pitcher of beer and 3$ for a glass (and I mean full glass... Not wine glass) represents some great and rare SF value. The waiter did warn, "Have you had our wine? It comes from a box." But it was totally drinkable, especially for the price. 

It'll be a sad day when this style of establishment has totally vanished from the city. You won't regret going but if you do please leave the city. We don't need you. Cheers.
author: Audrey N.

description:
I have been a customer my entire life. My parents used to go to Bravo Pizza... HANDS down one of the best in the city. One of my favorite pizzas is the "World Famous Bravo" highly recommend it... Also another typical order of ours is a pepperoni and pineapple. 

Their salads and house made dressings are too good! Wings are decent, pastas good too. 

TRY IT!
author: Ed S.

description: Owner was very genuine. Took the time to take our order and explain the menu. Good pizza. Good people.
author: Nicholas H.

description: I've been ordering here since I was a kid. Lately I've noticed their attention to detail has been diminishing. Cannot deny the good quality pizza but minor errors are becoming more major. I ordered a half bravo SPECIAL and have Hawaiian. Excited to open and eat, but I noticed that there was only pineapple and NO bacon or ham on the hawaiian. I called to inform them about it but they shift the blame on me. I also asked for cheese and pepper which I always received when I ordered pizza from here before but now they said I have to  cheese and pepper which I thought it would be automatically a part of the pizza like in the past. When I asked the driver for some cheese and pepper he did not have it also. If that's the case, maybe before hanging up, they should ask if we need cheese and pepper since all of a sudden you have to make a "special request" for it, lol. Like I said, it's the small things. Also paying attention goes a long way especially for a long time loyal customer. Well, little joes, here I come.
author: Cee B.

description: The pizza here is pretty delicious. They also give free cokacola whenever I order out. So that's cool.
author: Marcelo C.

description: Delicious pizza. Fast friendly service with a family style atmosphere. I love  places like this and wish there were more of them!!! Only thing is, I won't be here long enough to try all of the other items on the menu....pastas, ribs, salads. They sound wonderful! You can't go wrong with a pizza here. That I know for sure!!!
author: Mia M.

description:
Doughy, bland and over priced. What a winning combo.  This pizza is pretty much like all the pizza in the area and really in SF in general.  
 The sauce is bland and boring, the crust is too thick and bready with ZERO crunch or hint of flavor.
And $24 for a medium veggie pie is on the high end of reasonable.  
There are lots of pizza places around, I recommend finding one other than Bravo.
author: schmoo l.

description: Yelped "pizza" for all local searches and found bravo pizza. A pizza spot that I always  passed by around the Crocker-Amazon area In sf. So I finally decided to give it a try today and was NOT disappointed at all. All the reviews that I've read on this place were all positive reviews and lived up to it's reviews that people have put up. Called ahead of time and ordered the "bravo special" which consisted of pepperoni/sausage/onions/ and a whole lot of cheese. Be aware that it is a little hard trying to find parking but it's all worth the hassle cause the pizza is too good. Try it out and see for yourself folks, this place is a contender for the top pizza spot in sf. I'm serious, lol.
author: Jaydee S.

description: My boyfriend and I didn't want to leave the house so we ordered a pizza from Bravos this evening. He said he's been going here for years! We got a medium pepperoni and pineapple and the pizza is delicious! A big plus for me is the price is right! A medium pizza and a house salad was 26$! You really can't beat that for delivery. The pizza is so filling and we now both have lunch for tomorrow.
author: Geena G.

description: Got the Almost Everything Special. Toppings were ok 3 stars cause im not into the thick crust.
author: Angel L.

description: Ordered food for delivery at 6pm and was told it would be an hour.  It's now 8:27pm and still waiting. Called three times and told driver was on his way each time, and called again and now I've been on hold for the past 5 minutes. Never again.
author: Michael O.

description: My girlfriend and I (mostly I though) adore this place! Such a gem with delicious food and down to earth unpretentious vibe. We come here or order take-out every other week atleast and it has failed to disappoint us, actually maybe left us unsatisfied once, but that's okay! Pizza's are delicious, and the pasta's are HUGE although the pesto was a little bland, the wings are awesome probably some of the better wings I've had. I also love that they do these little half pitchers of Lagunitas for only $6, perfect drink portion size for someone who has a good thirst. The wait for food is alright and the prices are not too bad, pizza may be on the pricier side but you get what you pay for and it's damn good.
author: Koko P.

description: Their pizza is a decent pie. There isn't any parking in this area at all. But on a good note their not really a busy place so you can normally dine in without any Hassel.
author: Alonzo T.

description:
Delicious pizza. Thick crust with plenty of cheese! 

In the restaurant the wait can be kind of long to get seated and for the food.  Small quaint location, classic pizza restaurant decor. 

Delivery is great, decent wait times. You get free soda with a medium pizza. If you order a large side or ranch, which you should because it's amazing, it comes in a coffee cup! So much ranch, yummy!
author: Vanessa S.

description: The service gets worse and worse. I tried to make an order for pick up at 10p, they close at 11pm and they wouldnt take my order.  WTF?!
author: Princess P.

description: Best pizza in SF! I've been coming here since I was a kid, in the 80's. Their bread crust is sooooo good!
author: Rosa T.

description: great prompt service, even before a Warriors Playoff game. Person answering the phone was full of jokes which made for an easy, memorable customer service experience!
author: Carolyn D.

description: You have to try this pizza place out! Go with friends or a loved one. They make the best pizzas! That's all I have to say.
author: Lisa K.

description:
Not sure why everyone's complaining about the "rude" customer service over the phone. But maybe I just happen to be the fortunate one who's never experienced that with Bravo Pizza. 

My dad grew up in the area and I have family that still lives nearby, so whenever my dad and I are close, we'll pick up a pizza from Bravo. 

Never got the name of whoever picks up my calls, but they were very welcoming and very helpful. They even told me that I'd be getting three cans of coke with my order of a large pizza, not sure if that's a promotion or just standard, but it was pretty awesome to not have to pay a bit more for drinks. 

Parking in this area SUCKS, so if you have someone else with you, send them to get the pizza while you fill up at the chevron gas station across the street. The area does seem pretty sketchy at times, so it'd be best to be aware of your surroundings. 

Anyways, back to the ordering. The employee who took my order said it'd be ready in 25 minutes. I went in a little under 25 minutes and our pizza was ready. Workers were friendly, greeted me at the door, handled the pizza/cash exchange, and sent me off with a few sodas. 

The pizza is BOMB. I can see why even after 40 years, my dad will still throw down a $20 spot to pick up a pizza from here rather than Little Caesars. The pizza can be really hot initially, but once it cools a little then that'll be the perfect time to dig in. We got a sausage and pepperoni pizza. Though it can be a little bit oily, the pizza was cooked perfectly. There was a perfect balance of ingredients, and even the crust was almost like a breadstick. We went through 3/4ths of the pizza and were stuffed. Reheated, the pizza is still pretty damn good. 

If you got friends or family over, a craving for some pizza, and some extra cash to throw down, this is the spot you're looking for.
author: Robee A.

description:
I usually never step into parts of the city like this but I'm sort of glad I did. The appearance of the restaurant put together with the area it's in would usually steer me away immediately, but my girlfriend's family has been coming here for years since they used to live nearby so she dragged me along. We took a seat and I decided to just give it a shot. The waitress was very nice, a little on the slow and forgetful (she was elderly, so understandable), but nice nonetheless.

After getting our appetizer I had to use the restroom...very glad I didn't have to sit down because...well, if you don't like gas station bathrooms, then yeah. Self explanatory. The restrooms would be the only bad thing about this place. Yes, the dining area could use a little restoration, but it's fine.

When we got our pizza, I dug right in. Kinda hot, really hot, but I got through it. Unfortunately I could only eat 2 slices because they're HUGE. We took the rest home with us, after trying to flag down the waitress unsuccessfully for 30 minutes...

If you're ever in the area, give it a try. Just make sure to go the restroom before you get here.

And as for the lady below complaining about them not having bottled water, they have regular water, you know, in a cup. Why the hell do you need it to be in a bottle?
author: Marcos B.

description:
Ive liked coming to bravos since i was young and i was so excited when i moved back to the area and found out they delivered to my house. The last few times ive ordered it hasn't been as good. But the biggest turn off for me is when i called for delivery and the guy on the phone sounded totally annoyed that i was calling. I didn't even do anything wrong, i knew what i wanted, no hesitation, placed order, gave phone & addy...but he was soooooo rude to me. He even hung up on me! This has happened twice...yes, yes i tried again to make sure he wasn't just having a shitty day. I don't want to feel like I'm bothering someone when im just ordering dinner for my family, for $45 bucks i can sure feed them pretty much anywhere else. 

Also the delivery guy called me from outside, said he was here and he would just wait there for me....huh?! Isnt delivery usually to your door?? I dont live in a bad area so he couldn't be scared...but i do have stairs so maybe he was just lazy. Whatever...i still tipped him but don't plan on ordering from them anymore.
author: Alyssa S.

description: Loved my experience here! The pizza was soooo good--I loved the thicker crust and the loads of cheese they put on it. The small can definitely feed two hungry people! I also ordered wings which were super meaty and satisfying. I loved that this place is so casual and had a great atmosphere for just unwinding while eating pizza at a very affordable price. I'm so glad after living in SF for two years I have finally found my "go-to" pizza place!
author: Reina C.

description:
Awesome customer service. I came in at 12:47am tonight craving for a slice and they said they were already getting ready to close. Really sucked but the owner(?) said that there was a cancellation for a whole pizza so he can sell that to me. I don't know if there really was a cancellation or that that was the one he was going to take home for dinner but in a way, that was still a win for both of us. 

If I had extra cash on me, I would've tipped. I was only planning on buying a slice so unfortunately, I was unable to do so tonight. Next time I order a delivery from this place, I'll definitely tip extra. Thanks!
author: Jannet H.

description: They really need to step it up on delivery time it shouldn't  take a hour in the half to 2 hours for deliveries , act like you want our business
author: Chris C.

description: Love the pizza it nice and cheesy and the crust is great. Delivery time is good. Great service at the restaurant but it's a bit old and runned down and very dark inside.
author: Celina A.

description: Best pizza ever in life ! Best Ranch ! Only place to eat pizza in the city ! Hands down !
author: Berlyn M.

description: This place is great. I came in the weekend and the waitress who was really nice took my order. Once the food came it was crazyyy the portions. I had enough food for days to come. The alfredo pasta is soo good and also the homemade bread they give you. They also offer delivery but i havent had a chance to try it out yet. It is also in the corner of geneva and mission wich is a major transportation hub. Great customer service i sure will be coming back.
author: John W.

description:
The Place

I really like this place. The service is SUPER friendly. It feels like this is one of those neighborhood places that have been around for a while, and I really like that about them. I don't really live nearby (I live in SSF), and it's a bit of a trek to come out but I like them enough to make the drive. Parking can be a bit tough, bring help; in case you can't find a spot just "deploy troops" to pick up your order while the driver circles the block.

The pizza

Being from SSF my choices for pizza are Di Napoli, Seniore's, and Toto's. Bravo is easily my favorite among these because it is well cooked (not soggy/runny which has sometimes happened with Di Napoli), the crust is thick but not bread-y (Seniore's), and they are generous with the toppings. I also like that I get cokes with my order when I pick up, it's a nice bonus (something Toto's doesn't have). I've tried the "almost everything" and the "cute greek" (I'm a fan of fetta cheese).
author: Jose U.

description:
What's wrong with this place?
Did they change there number or something
Because I just called about 3 times and made it up to 3 min each and nun of the times they picked up the phone!!
author: Efrain Y.

description:
Will not be coming back here. Bread for pizza is too thick. The onions in the "world famous" is off-putting. Restaurant is dirty and guy at front is rude.

Go to Phillies across the street to save yourself some time and get a good meal.
author: Danielle R.

description:
Had pizza from here but for delivery since it's close to my house but was too lazy to pick up.

Delivery:
*it's free
*although they say it'll take at least an hour to come to your house if they're, they still deliver to your pizza to your house within 40 - 45 minutes. That's the average estimate time for them to come to your house. Can take longer if they are really busy. They also give two free coke can for doing delivery

Pizzas:
I had the medium size of "world famous bravo" pizza for about 19.40 plus tax and tip, it'll be over $20. It's a bit pricy for a pizza but then again, it's one of those specialty pizza.
Had plenty of meat which consist of pepperoni, salami, sausage, mushroom and onions. It has a lot of cheese but was a bit oily. The whole pizza itself is very delicious. I like how the crust has that fluffy texture and it wasn't too thick.
author: Julie N.

description:
You may end up hating the place if you come here with certain expectations.  They're not New York style (over-rated), Chicago style (no one here gets it right), nor California style (go elsewhere if that's what you're looking for). 

Bottom line is Bravo is not the best...they're not striving for neapolitan-istic, organically sustainable fodder. 

Bravo is a great throwback to a classic pizzeria style pizza.  It's on the thicker side, loaded with ingredients and greasy. Will definitely be back!
author: Zoran L.

description:
When I eat pizza, it's either deep dish pizza or BRAVO'S PIZZA! 

I know it's not everyone's favorite, but I really like the thickness and consistency of the crust.  Moreover, my hubby and I love, love, love Hawaiian pizza and compared to other places, this place makes it the most flavorful. 

We've tried their other pizzas and have no complaints.  If we could, we'd eat Bravo's pizza all day, every day.
author: H. C.

description:
Best Italian/Pizza restaurant in the area. I haven't had a bad dish from here. The pizza is delicious; layers of flavor, ingredients and hefty portions of cheese. They don't skimp on the pizza. The pasta is great, their marinara sauce in particular is addicting. I highly recommend the shrimp marinara. Meatballs are the bomb. Large and consistently juicy, not dried out like other restaurants I've been to. Eggplant parmesan is always good, cooked perfectly and layered nicely with that awesome marinara sauce and gooey cheese in there. Their minestrone soup is the best I've ever had. I've found out that they've had the same recipe for over 50 years and it's hella good. It has a slightly thicker texture than other minestrone soups and is chunky with veggies and noodles. The hot wings are great but can be spicy. Be sure to get a side of their house-made ranch with it. I'm still working my way through the menu but I'm looking forward to ordering more from Bravo.

In terms of delivery, I've never had an issue. I think I may be a bit more understanding since I've worked in the restaurant industry too though. But if the meal is delicious, I don't mind waiting in order to allow time for my food to be prepared and cooked properly. If you want pizza in 20 minutes, cook a frozen one at home. In terms of wait time though, I haven't had to wait for more than 1 hour - 1 hour 15 min. Some dishes take longer than others, but if you order during off peak hours, then it can arrive in less than an hour. I've ordered on a Sunday and received my order, piping hot, in less than 40 minutes.  Always be sure to tip well too!
author: Stephanie R.

description:
This review is not for the pizza because I didn't try it, but rather for the poor customer service over the phone.
I called and placed an order with a guy and unfortunately the lack of customer service over the phone prompted me to call back within a couple of minutes to cancel my order.  Did the guy think I was doing him a favor when I called to place my order because there are plenty of pizza parlors within a 5 mile radius?
Hey guy, if you ever check yelp I hope you read this and perhaps improve on your phone etiquette. 
Btw, I ended up ordering from North Beach Pizza after I cancelled my order and I definitely felt appreciated by the lady who took my order.
author: Meuy S.

description:
I am becoming some what of a pizza connoisseur, next to sandwiches, it's G's favorite food. Of all the pizza places he has taken me too, this one is the best. I don't know what it is, maybe the soft, thick crust, maybe it's the sauce. It's just the best. I have dined in and picked up, I recommend picking it up. They are always so busy I think the wait might irritate some. 

You have to take their smug attitude with a grain of salt, it's a pizza parlor that been around forever. Don't be off put by the guy at the counter, he's actually really nice.
author: Kristin F.

description: Customer service is poor super rude!! I ordered a pizza from this place they told me it was a 1 hr delivery my pizza arrived after 2 hrs I tried calling to see where it was at all the lady said was its on it way and she hanged up on me there customer service is poor.
author: Vicky R.

description:
Wow!

So it's a Saturday night. The girlfriend and I are hungry after a long day of her studying for finals, and my finalizing some paper work from an overly elongated work week. We both come to the conclusion that we want pasta, but not just any pasta. 

We both were crazing something calorie ridden, that would leave us fat, happy, and likely bed bound due to our arteries deciding to clog up with nothing more than pure fat, in it's elemental form.

We chose Bravo Pizza, and in no uncertain terms was this a bad decision. I ordered the Fettuccine Alfredo with Chicken, while she ordered the Spaghetti and Meatballs, both with a side salad. To accent it, a pitcher of Barqs Root Beer. I particularly enjoyed the latter bit, as I'm a Louisiana native and frankly, Barqs might as well be a supplement for water back in the NOLA.

To our surprise, a "side" salad that was about the size of an entree in of itself, arrived before us. It wasn't entirely complex, but good nonetheless. Fresh iceberg, wonderfully firm tomato quarters, sliced salami, and a few other goodies between. If the size of the "side" salad was any clue as to what our entree would be like, we were certainly prepared for greatness.

Despite that, we were still shocked at the size of the entree. My Alfredo literally ended up feeding me that night (despite my best efforts at finishing it, I could only tackle half of it as it was quite literally a few POUNDS of pasta...) as well as for the subsequent day's, lunch and dinner. Large strips of all white meat chicken strewn through a battlefield of noodles and creamy Alfredo sauce. Admittedly, the sauce was a bit too fluid, but this is no five star restaurant and at the end of the day what I wanted was not something that appealed aesthetically (though it did in it's own macabre way), but instead I sought out a meal that would appeal to the sense of taste. Needless to say, it did that and then some, a sense of satisfaction that lasted quite literally, days. 

It's also worth noting that the feel of the place is pretty damn nice. Not in a ritzy, classy way. But in a more, divey, Mama's kitchen kind of way. The natural wood coating the walls and ceiling, numerous bits of nostalgia covering the walls, and just the atmosphere of the place were all splendid. It's definitely a very "warm and homey" feeling place. I'd see no better environment to sit, chow down on food, while watching the game with a big group of friends.
author: Kenneth M.

description: I'm not even writing a review. Their pizza doesn't need me to gloat about it. Just go. Delicious sauce, good pizza, awesome owner.
author: Sara P.

description: Im so upset with the pizza i order! It was burn. But yeah we still eat it cause im so hungry especially im pregnant so i need to eat lol .. I waited for this pizza for an hour nd 15mns! I always order pizza here i love the fact they give you two free can soda!
author: Lara J.

description:
Tried this place for the first time tonight. Called in a delivery and whoever I spoke to was a total jerk from beginning to end of our phone conversation.

But, maybe he was having a bad day. The pizza came much faster then they have said. Also, it came with some free cokes!
The pizza was great! We got the Greek one, it was very good.

So, bad first impression but a solid landing.
author: Ben H.

description:
To start off, let me be clear: the food here is BOMB!!!! 

However,  tonight a friend and I had an unfortunately off-putting experience. We called to order a pizza and had possibly the worst service I have ever received. I called to place the order and was immediately put on hold, which is forgivable seeing as though we called late night on a Friday. While taking my basic info for the delivery, the employee was extremely short and condescending. He rudely corrected me when I gave him the standard billing zip code as opposed to the entire billing address. I immediately apologized for the minor miscommunication, and provided the necessary information to complete the order. The worst part of all was that I was never thanked for my business, instead I was hung up on.
author: Megan L.

description: We have had pizza and meals delivered on a few occasions from Bravo. The prices are reasonable. Each time theorizes is awesome and the other items hot and delicious. Each time the delivery man has been the same friendly guy-Pete. We are happy repeat customers. He quoted an hour for delivery, but was quicker than anticipated.
author: D T.

description: Had a great pizza here at Bravo Pizza the other night.  Ordered a cheese pizza,  came out piping hot,  lots of cheese,  great dough lots of flavor,  good crunch on the crust, yet tender on the inside.  Top notch, but it's the customer service that has me coming back.  The same night I came in for a pizza, about 11:00p, I dropped my bus pass (must have fallen out of my pocket). Anxiously, I awaited opening, retracing my steps,  I walk in,  tell my story,  and after a few well deserved jokes, the owner/manager reaches around the counter and hands me my bus pass, says they found it while cleaning, and he thought it must have been mine.  Made my weekend!  So I tell the story to my cousin, who then goes on to tell me how great their marinated mushrooms are,  so I'm back,  at my new favorite pizza joint,  salivating these amazing sautéed mushrooms.  A true staple of the Excelsior district. Great food, awesome staff,  I love this place!
author: Michael M.

description: Terrible pizza, and expensive for what it is. Rubbery cheese, mediocre pepperoni, homemade crust. And I mean homemade like, you made the pizza (badly) and it's baked and you're starving so you'll eat it, but you would be extremely disappointed if, let's say, a pizza joint tried to pizza that to you. My bf's dad laughed at us when he saw the box. He followed up with "Bravo pizza has been awful as long as I've been alive."
author: Shaymaa M.

description: Very good pizza -- and this is coming from a "New Yorker"! The sauce to cheese/meat ratio is good, and the crust is fresh and well made. Some might consider it a little too thick, I might even be apart of that some group however, the quality is consistent, and very delicious. I'd skip the wings, as they left me wanting for more, but the pizza definitely hit a homerun!
author: Marques R.

description:
Best pizza in town!!!!
This place is family friendly and the menu has something for everyone.  Pete and his sons run the joint and they're all terrific.
author: Robert B.

description: My absolute favorite pizza! I have been going to bravo's for many years now and they never disappoint. The only thing that some people (not me of course) may not like is their thick crust. (You can ask for thin crust if u want a pizza with a normal thickness.) The customer service is great. They have never mistaken my order or have been rude to me which is not something I can say for many pizzerias.
author: Alejandra L.

description:
I used to like bravos pizza....

Tonight, I felt like something different. I usually order from Haystack. I call up Bravo pizza, the phone rings, someone answers but doesn't say anything and then hangs up. I thought someone hung up by accident. So I call again. Same thing happens. Maybe this is a fluke so I try one more time...... Phone rings, someone answers, then call hangs up, all the while, I'm screaming hello! Into the phone. 

Guess bravo's won't being getting my business anytime soon.
author: angela s.

description:
This is your basic, solid, good pizza and pasta place. No zero-g arugula; no raw-milk cheese from yoga-inspired cows: just your pizza and your pasta with no surprises. And they deliver to Daly City.

The ravioli were not overcooked; the Greek pizza was warm and even; the salad dressing could have used more vinegar (but I say that everywhere), and the to-go drink cup the dressing came in had tape over the drink-hole so it would stay tidy: nice touch.

My call was fine: nice guy, I complimented him on the Tom's Special, all good. Perhaps they heeded the recent reviews about phone courtesy.
author: Richard H.

description:
The people go above and beyond.  They're very friendly and make sure to take care of you.  I got an extra can of coke because my delivery was broken up into two mini deliveries for some reason.

The pepperoni pizza is fine.  I liked the cheese and the fact that they followed my "light sauce" instructions.  It is very doughy and the crust was very, very plain.  I normally like the crust but I didn't eat this one...too plain.

After reading the rave reviews about the fresh bread, I had to try.  Unfortunately for delivery they must send something else.  They brought some very thick slices of clearly bread out of a bag.  The garlic bread was prepared on the same and was no good.

I'd probably just order from Round Table over this place again.
author: Lauren D.

description:
Pizza was edible: toppings were plentiful and the quality was decent. Ultimately, it tasted like a glorified papa johns pizza. 

"Very Hot Wings" were slimy, greasy, over cooked- yet not crispy. Also, the chicken was loaded with dark veins. Ranch dressing was good.
author: Frank B.

description: Me and my family have been ordering from this place since I can remember. They always make great pizzas and even better salads.
author: Joshua P.

description: If you have a big appetite. this is your place. The pizza. is old school.and will not. leave you hungry.If you are on a diet. avoid this place. and keep the food for others. who enjoy it.Enjoy the homemade bread. it is awesome. Great food at. a great. price.
author: RICHARD M.

description: Order the Bravo's Special, Add garlic, get ranch on the side, and pick up the order so you get free cans of coke. Thank me later.
author: Sonny S.

description:
GOOD FOOD 

Garlic Bread is yummy and cheap. 

Pizza is good.

Chicken Wings are tasty. 

Open Late!

minus one because of the neighborhood.
author: Jenny E.

description: Like the pretty girl who reluctantly said yes or Mr. Tambourine man with the good song, Bravo pizza will make you wait. I was told that delivery would be an hour to an hour 20. Understandable for the early evening but actual wait time was over two hours. And, yeah, the pizza is great! But I would have loved a plain pizza about an hour and a half ago.
author: Brett R.

description:
I used to live a lot closer to Bravo, but thankfully they deliver to my house in Bernal Heights.  They never fail to satisfy.  The place is not much to look at, and the ambiance is lacking.

We had a pepperoni pizza for the kids, and a combo for the adults.  And one for me, the Pesto Pesto, with tomato.  This has pesto sauce, garlic, and feta.  Adding tomato made it a LOT better.  Trust me and order it this way.  One of the better pizzas I've had.

They are open very late and take cash only for delivery. If you eat in or pick up, you can use your credit card.
author: Michael M.

description:
Bravo Pizza is the BEST. I've always loved their pizza and so I decided to have my birthday lunch here even though it was risky (the place is not that big). But why did I even worry at ALL?! They handled everything so smoothly and professionally. I was so thankful. 

When I got there they had reserved half the restaurant (for about 40 people) for us and quickly began serving salads and drinks and they even let us bring in and cut cake!

It wasn't a hassle to feed everyone or pay. The pizza slices are huge so it ended up being super cheap for everyone. I had a great time and can't think of another place that would do such an amazing job.

Thank you Bravos for making my day so special :)
author: Jennifer C.

description:
As a kid during the summers I would live in SF with relatives down Geneva and we would always get Bravo's!  Growing up I knew Bravo's as the pizza to get!

I LOVE THE WORLD FAMOUS BRAVO SPECIAL!!!! when I get a craving for pizza I tend to lean towards Bravo's.  Whenever I post on FB that I get Bravo's my mom always calls me asking me to bring her some (in Vallejo...)  

They are really accurate with their timing for pick-up! I love how they give free soda's for their carry out orders, I never drink them but I know I'll have them in the fridge for company.
author: Donovan R.

description:
A group of friends decided to hang around after attending the DHL All Star FanFest with me so I decided to order a couple of pizzas for dinner.  I had never tried Bravo Pizza in the neighborhood, but I had heard some very good things about their food.  If you like thick, bready crusts and large servings of toppings, Bravo may be the pizza for you too.  We had a couple of large pizzas delivered, one with ground beef, sausage, mushrooms and olives and another with chicken, pesto and garlic, and when these arrived they must have been two of the heaviest large pizzas I've ever handled.

The crust was baked fairly crispy on the bottoms but nice and chewy up top and inside.  There must have been an additional half inch of toppings and cheese on each.  The tomato sauce was not too tangy and not too sweet.  The chicken was all white meat, and the pesto was quite good but just a bit on the oily side.  I would easily have given this pizza four and a half stars, but it arrived in just about 35 minutes even though the order taker told us it'd be an hour and they threw in a free six pack of icy cold Coke.  My friends and I thought it was a killer deal.  I will order from them again.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
Classic Native San Francisco pizza. Gone here for decades and it is still one of
The best pizza parlors in Bay Area.
author: Jay V.

description:
Unbelievable!!!!!! 

I ordered #8 which was the pesto, fresh garlic pizza with chicken and they forgot the MAIN ingredient, PESTO.
