After me and a friend picked up with pizza and settled home, we opened the pizza box and did not see any pesto sauce. We automatically assumed the pesto sauce was probably spread under all the toppings. I take a bite there's no pesto but marinara. WHAT THE HELL!? So we called but no one answered. We had to drive all the way back and told the guy we ordered the pesto pizza but there's no pesto sauce! These were his exact words. "Usually it's marinara sauce and pesto sauce topped together, but it seems like our chef completely forgot the pesto sauce. Sorry, we're closed. There's nothing I can do unless you want the pesto sauce on the side or I give you a $10 off your next visit. We already turned off everything." 

I'm already irritated the fact that they didn't pick up their phone when I called 25 minutes before they closed. And the fact that I had to waste MY gas and MY time to drive all the way back there for their mistake and all I get is side of pesto sauce or $10 off my next visit. Another factor is, I haven't had pizza for at least 2 years and for me to give this place a try because of their 4 star ratings, total disappointment. My first experience here was a major disappointment although he gave us two free cokes. I don't even drink soda. I ended up asking for the side of pesto because I am not coming back here. I don't mind spending a lot of money when it comes to good food and good service. But I'd say this was my waste of $26.00 I have spent. 

Sorry, me thinks not.
author: Ella A.

description: Free sodas ! This place is gorgeous perfect date night and it won't break the bank !
author: Rafael F.

description: My parents basically have bought me this pizza all my life, occasionally Costco pizza but this is the bomb! Love it here and love the pizza. The last couple of years they have been adding less cheese and more bread, which I have felt a little let down by so I make sure to let them know that's not how I want my pizza. The people are there are extremely friendly! When I was around 10 I was looking at the dough and one of the workers there gave me a piece to play with and take home with me! I'll never stop coming here for as long as I live in SF!
author: Mellany Q.

description: I dont live in the city but have known about this place for YEARS.  I have alot of family around there. Its been a while since I've been but still tastes as good as I remember! BombDOTCom
author: Cindy M.

description:
I always loved Bravos Pizza. Out of all the pizza joints I go to in the Bay Area this has to be #1. I love the fact that they never go out of there old school ways. The place looks the same (of course they can use some touching up) not the best chairs in the house. I don't mind that at all because I'm there for the pizza & it's always 5 stars. Me and my family always order "MISSION COMBO" it's very delish. The waitress is super nice she's like a sweet Filipino auntie=) I love the cashier he's a young handsome Caucasian guy who has a great smile and nice sense of humour. 

I will return again and again!
author: Cee L.

description: Dirty, disappointing. First time going to this place. Booster seat was covered in grime. Completely filthy and repulsive. Thankfully I had some Clorox wipes in my purse! Seats were falling apart. Tried ordering juice for my daughter. They don't sell any!!! No bottled water either. Our salad was terrible despite it being a Greek salad. Who messes up feta cheese?! Our pizza tonight was not fully cooked either. I didn't walk out because I had been I invited to dinner so it was really out of respect for my friend who was paying for the meal, but I'll never go here again. I have no idea how people can eat here and praise the restaurant. It's a health hazard.
author: S. A.

description:
I ordered, for delivery, South of the border.  It's spicy sausages, jallapenos, olives, bell peppers and onions.  It came at exactly 1 hour as the website had advertised and gave me a free soda with it.

I was worried when I saw my pizza.  I'm a meat lover and there weren't enough meat on it.  The sausages looked like miniature pepperoni.  It looked like I ordered a vegetarian pizza.  

It did taste like it was all vegetables, it overpowered the thin sliced sausages.  But it was actually good.  It was extra cheesy, really thick cheese layer on it.  The jallapenos excited me since I like everything spicy.  

I count this as my first vegetarian pizza experience, which I enjoyed.  I'll order from them again...
author: Pam S.

description: We always get the All Meat pizza. Totally recommend it. We love it! And the side salad is so simple but perfect size and is so good with the house dressing. This place is one of our favorites. You have to try it. And the staff is always pleasant.
author: Regan C.

description: This is a local spot that I grew up eating the pizza hit or miss BCUZ sometimes the crust is way too thick SO make sure ask for thin crust ALSO the lasagna is made to order its takes a little time but it's awesome I order well done bcuz I like the cheese to get a little extra crispy
author: Teddy S.

description:
My friend orders from here often.

Our pizza had a thick layer of cheese on a tasty French bread-like crust. The sauce wasn't bad either as it had good tomato taste in it. I thought the toppings were kind of skimpy, but I can't really complain about something I didn't pay for. Overall, I'd say it was a very good pizza since between the two of us we polished off more than half of the extra large pizza.

Delivery was exactly as stated on the telephone, and they added three free cans of Coke to the order.
author: Sara A.

description: Great pizza! Made fresh to order. Thick crust and slightly crisp on the crust. Marinara sauce was really fresh and delicious as well. We had dinner here a few days ago on our trip to San Francisco. We're definitely glad we bought our pizza from here. Try it!!
author: Crystal D.

description: I love there pizza bread meatball and pasta. My nephew every year has his birthday get together there at bravo pizza..Good services  nice worker.  it's great!
author: Nayely A.

description: With the good reviews I thought I would give this place a try. Our server seemed like she was not having a good day, and was not very friendly. The other 2 workers were really nice though. We ordered a pizza, which took a very long time, so definitely order an appetizer if you're hungry. The pizza was good. Could have used more sauce but it was good- not great.  I honestly would probably not go back. There was another pizza place across the street, I'll have to try that one next time I'm in town.
author: Jazmin R.

description: Bravo piazza was my local piazza joint until the atrocious service I received last night. The service has always been bad, but over the years myself and the community have watched as the quality of service and products have diminished.  Last night I called   in my order, and the rude gentlemen acted as if I was bothering him by placing an order.  After some consideration, I called back to cancel my order and I was hung up on.  I do not care how long you have been in business, your customer loyalty is what keeps you in business.  You lost multiple regular customers in the community because of this event and your declining level of service.  Avoid this place at all costs, unless you want to deal with the smug attitude of the employees.
author: Lauren F.

description: The bathroom was really dirty!!! But the pizza was delicious AND every body was really nice. They're always busy when we come. But when we are on this side of SF, WE Always stop by. This is my husband's favorite busy place. The building could use some improvements but don't let that scare you away!!!! Just order out! ;)
author: chanell w.

description:
I was 1st introduced to Bravo's by my boyfriend back in (2008). I recently stopped by here again last week on 06/25/12.  He being from the Excelsior in San Francisco knows all of the best neighborhood & city spots. Him & his family have came here for years it being (1) of there favorite pizza places & I can see why.

Now, this place looks like your average vintage pizzeria. Leather seats, booths dim lighting, a warm inviting family friendly environment. Once you taste there food you can see why they are way beyond average.This place honestly rivals my Zachary's Chicago style Pizza in Berkeley. They are just (2) different style pizza's. This is traditional & Zachary's are deep dish. This is the only Pizza I can say I like as much as Zachary's. 

Here is why they are so great. The pizza's cheese stretches on to your plate, the dough is made just right. It is soft but not gooey & a little crispy on the bottom.  It's marinara dance in your mouth & is pleasure every bite. So much spice & flavor in (1) slice of pizza. If you can believe it the crust even has a flavor in it, its not just a flavorless hard crunchy dough like most places. It is soft & actually has a taste. There is nothing bland about this pizza every inch of it is packed with flavor. I am so in love. lol


Another (1) of my favorite dishes that is worth adding on to your meal is the Pesto Ravioli. This is how it should be made. I swear they need to patent it. the raviolis are smothered in a creamy Pesto Sauce & oh is it so good.. I have been to Italian Restaurants that specialize in Pesto Pasta & they wish it was as good as this. This is hands down the best Pesto Pasta I have ever had in my life. i have yet to find any competition for this Pesto work of art.


I've never been to a Restaurant where they perfected everything but seem to have everything down packed. Everything I've ever tried here taste fantastic.  I love them & can not wait to come back. 

-Elena ;)
author: Elena A.

description: A small pizza feeds two, decent. A small (12") 3-topping pizza is not even close to worth it ($16 after tax). Mostly dough, skimpy on sauce, generous only with cheese. Toppings not generous at all. Crust is same quality that you would get a lunch cafeteria, boring, a turn-off. Everything else was normal at best. Had to struggle to find the mushrooms in my pizza. Also the guy who answered the phone gave off an almost comically stereotypical impression that he hated his job, merely by the sound of his monotonous voice. All in all, would never come here again, but could imagine the possibility having a decent experience. I am only satisfied because I was hungry as fuck. Emphasis on the fact that this is blatantly overpriced.
author: Mauricio A.

description: I grew up on this pizza! Just had it last night and still is my pizza of choice! Recently visited family in Tacoma, WA. A few of my cousins who live there grew up here and remembers Bravo's Pizza. When we all were trying to explain to the kids how Bravo's is hands down the best, it just couldn't be explained. Words could not do it justice!
author: George I.

description: This place sucked! I guess the pizza was pretty good. But PLEASE get rid of that fat waitress that didn't know anything.  It took an hour for our food while she mingled in the corner with some drunk girls, inviting herself to their parties. She went to the other corner to text. Came over to us 30 minutes into our "service" to say it's almost done. finally... when we asked for dipping sauce took 15 min. she did NOT inform us that we would be charged 2.50 for each when we asked. and called sides. .. ranch and marinara.  really. the guys up front were amazing, picking up her slack. the two gentle men aside us got their pizza in no more than 20 min. I won't go back in there. maybe to go next time
author: Tiffany A.

description:
I'm a pizza lover so from Bravo's to Little Ceasar's I've had every one.
This place by far made my taste buds toes curl! If I was  a fat man I'd die here eating everything. The pizza had lots of sauce, the cheese stringy the meat Mama Mia!

Even the wings.....licked my fingers!

but by far as much as I love pizza I love cheesy garlic bread......I had an OoooOOMmmGGgggEEE!!! moment for realz! We spent like $40-$50 pigging out,
it was about 7-8 of us & we didn't have leftovers cuz I had 3rds :) Food Heaven!
author: Nicole T.

description:
Some friends and I ordered two extra large pizzas for delivery, and they told us it would be about $60, and that it would take about an hour. Over an hour passed, and the pizza had not yet arrived, so we called again to check the status of our order. They said that they were "on their way". After over 2 hours of waiting, the delivery man finally showed up with the pizzas. I guess they had forgotten our order. 

We were expecting some damn good pizza at $30 each, but the pizzas tasted no better than what you would get at a domino's pizza. 

Overall, bad customer service, mediocre pizza, way overpriced.
author: Brian F.

description:
Ever feel like you just had one looooong day at work? Well, today was one of them! I didn't feel like cooking. I didn't feel like going out to eat. First thing that came to mind was local neighborhood pizza....and Bravo's is the winner!! Domino's or Little Caesars will never do.

It's not the healthiest meal on the block, but hey it's fast and full of cheesy gooey goodness. The best part is that they deliver. Yesss!!

I called in the order and for one large classic pepperoni pizza and buffalo wings came to a measly $28. Small price to pay for "laziness". Forty-five minute wait. Sure, why not? I'm fine with that just as long as I don't have to pick it up. Besides, parking is scarce and the restaurant seems more like the "pick-up" or "to-be-delivered" type of joint anyways. 

So the goods arrive, and on time. They met their 45-minute mark with 10 minutes to spare. They even added a few complimentary cans of coke. Awwe nice, especially when unexpected.... thank you! The pizza arrived heavy, warm and bagged with the usual condiments- parmesan, pepper flakes, & ranch sauce. You open up that all too familiar Bravo pizza box, and out comes steam straight into your face ahhhh!  

The pizza is good, stacked with extra cheese, big pepperoni,  and a thick crust. My kids are big pizza fans, but just one slice hit the spot for me. Now I feel like running, especially after two chicken wings. I wasn't too thrilled with the wings, excess seasoning and looked a little on the dry side. 

Regardless, it hit the spot- fast, good, and easy!
author: Joy A.

description: The best cheese and best flavor. Wish they have a stuffed Crust or cheese crust because the crust was like a brick of bread
author: Hector F.

description: This pizza so NASTY!!!!! They CANT COOK!!! My aunt and cousins gotten sick by eating this pizza place
author: Xochitl F.

description:
Yay to cheap pitchers ($8- $10) but nay to almost everything else. Their buffalo wings were soft and overcooked while their meatballs were undercooked! The meatballs were extremely questionable because parts of the meatball seemed frozen! 

The pizza was decent, more crust than toppings and cheese. I enjoyed the environment; good place to hang out and share a few pitchers. If you're hungry, share a pizza but stay away from everything else!
author: Caroline T.

description: Food is great, but the service is really bad. Rude on the phone, and rude when they deliver.
author: Rhenzie Anne F.

description:
My boyfriend and his family have been obsessed with this place his whole life, and ever since I met him 8 years ago I have heard about and been to Bravo's several times. 

It's one of those places that's been around so long it's hard for them to mess up. The crust is good, the cheese is good, the toppings are fresh and abundant. 

Recently I had the sauteed mushrooms which were really fresh and plump, and they put the good pizza cheese on the salad, which is one of my favorite salads ever. 

Pete the owner is one of the best hosts I've ever seen. The man looks like he busts his butt for that place, and it really shows through the food.
author: Nikki G.

description: Love the pizza hate the customer service. The guy on the phone has horrible people skills. I think his name was Frank. He hung up on us 3 times. The owner, delivery guy and waiters are ALWAYS in a good mood EXCEPT for Frank. Geez Louise that guy has issues. If he's like that on the phone I wonder how horrible he is in person. BLEH.
author: Mileti A.

description:
I love Bravo's! 

This has definitely become my family's pizza place. When I have my family come up from SoCal this is where we all gather or just on a Friday night, I will come with my parents or friends to Bravo's to come for some yummy pizza!

Pete, the owner, is just the greatest! He's been nothing but amazing to my family and I. The whole staff is amazing! So friendly and even when they have a packed house, they are still on top of everything. 

The whole family atmosphere, yummy food, and wonderful staff makes Bravo's my favorite restaurant! I will definitely be coming back for years to come! 

I give them 1,000,000,000 stars!!!!
author: Anastasia C.

description: This is not a hipster area not inner mission so you should def come here for quality pizzas!  bf picked up the pizza and said the service is great.  style is thick and cheesy with fresh ingredients.  very reasonable price.  a whole big pizza lasted for 2 meals for us and it costed just like 20 dollars.   I love this area bec it still feels like mission with exotic and flavorful regional character to me :)
author: Shuting Z.

description:
Great pizza! Worth all the hype! Cheese galore! 

Note to the owner: Don't change a thing and don't skimp out on portions it will keep your customers happy.
author: M R.

description:
Pizza is the Best 
Family dinner salad is the best
best ranch i ever had 

5 star pizza!!!!!
author: Henry G.

description:
Bravo.

It was a job very well done. Five star performance.

Most memorable was the pizza sandwich. Served on homemade bread with an insane amount of veggies and marinara sauce.

Would have needed twice the amount of bread to contain everything. Not an option. So things got messy. Very messy. And oh so delicious.

Cheese and salami as well if you are into it. Can't even imagine the epicness.

Small pizza is still feeding me three days later. Couldn't decide if I was happier with the turkey bacon option or that they took my request for light cheese seriously and kept it minimal. All I know is I was happy. Very happy.

So was my wallet. Eleven bucks for a pie that would be an easy fifteen elsewhere.

Pete (owner?) was proud of his creations. As he should be. This is one of the best pizza and sandwich experiences in the city.
author: Jason B.

description: My Family has been ordering from bravo's pizza for years and it's always been okay for me. But the one night my son asked me to order him a pizza so we can Enjoy it while we watch movies, We don't get what we asked for and we get something that could harm my child. I ordered a pepperoni mushroom olive pizza. What I got instead was a pepperoni and onion pizza and my son is allergic to onions. I was upset with this so I called back and told them what the problem was. The reply I got back was oh I am sorry yeah but we're close right now but I can give you a $10 credit for the next time you order pizza. Didn't have much of another choice.   I don't eat onions either because I've learned to take it out of everything we eat, or not add to the things we eat. So now I've got a medium whole pizza that I have to give or throw away. Very disappointing.
author: Monique S.

description: I always order my pizza here. Best pizza ever in my opinion. They do take an hour to deliver but I am always satisfied with what they serve. I have no gotten a pizza that I didn't like. They also deliver different types of food. They are always busy but it's worth it.
author: Yasuko R.

description:
Best pizza I have ever tasted!

I've been coming here since I was a little girl, and now my children love it!

I used to live right around the corner from Bravo's and now I live in the East Bay,
I will STILL come to the city for some Bravo pizza!  YUM!
author: CM M.

description: Rude people,walk in and walk out,no good costumer service at all,got me waiting for a long time and u say forget it
author: Alex G.

description: We first visited this restaurant while on vacation 12 years ago and have craved this food all those years.  Doing a recent trip to SF with friends we decided to go for our final night in the city.  The service friendly and personal just like we remembered.  The food...better the. We remembered.  The Sautéed Mushrooms and Parm Chicken the best ever.  Do not hesitate to eat here just save a table for me.
author: Tara B.

description:
After watching a play in the city, my family was hungry and I remembered this place from my childhood, I am glad I did. 
First, the atmosphere is family-orientated. The place has a charm that comes from a family who cares about their customers and the community as a whole. 
The food was delicious, we ordered an extra large (not regarding the warning our waiter gave us that it was huge!) and were stuffed within two slices. The salad we ordered was plentiful and hearty and set things up nicely for the pizza. We ordered a salami, mushroom and sausage pie and it was delish. 
The icing on the cake for this pizza place is the service. The waiter was awesome and even joked with my kids. The owner of the place gave my girls a quarter so that they could buy a gum from the gumball machine. Friendly people, great food. What's not to like here?
author: Carlos V.

description: I waited over 2 hours for delivery on a Saturday night and I live close by!  I agree with a previous reviewer: the pizza is doughy, lacks flavor and is OVER PRICED!!  I tried it because I heard these rave reviews but honestly I'm going back to my all time favorite: Seniores Pizza!  Waay more flavor, less expensive and much faster delivery!!
author: Dina K.

description: Been ordering from here off and on for the last 15 years.  Ordered 2 pizzas, a Hawaiian and a sausage and pepperoni pizza...They were good except of the toppings kinda fell off the Hawaiian when u bit into it.  The bread was soft and the pizzas taste good in general.
author: Maria D.

description:
So we went back like fools because of all the glorious reviews...once again confirming my first review...this pizza is utter crap.

Its still the saltiest pizza i've ever tasted in my life...and the day after (today) i'm cramping up like mad, i've had the sh**s since this am and am very bloated (cause of all the SALT).

Guys...buy better cheese...what are you using polly -o? its so friggin salty...it ruins what actually tastes like (when you eat a piece without cheese on it) like decent dough. The sauce was also salty but not as bad as the cheese...its cheap ass cheese they use and I for one will NEVER eat here again.

Little Joes down the block kills this place on their worst day.
author: Dean M.

description: New to the city and my brother took me here. Some of the best pizza in town and their portions on pasta and bread are freaking amazing. Love Bravo Pizza. The owner is always going table to table and talking with guests. Very personal and I love it
author: John B.

description:
Been eating here for over 30 years, and I must say, my favorite pizza all time. But to be clear, you must be a fan of thick crust. If you are a thin crust type of person, you will struggle a bit.
The toppings are fresh, the cheese is generous, and if you order to go, they'll give you a free can of coke or two
author: FILL S.

description:
The trouble started when we tried to order over the phone: The guy spoke extremely minimal English, and my boyfriend had to repeat himself over 3 times for each item we were trying to order. 

Boyfriend: "I'd like some spaghetti with pesto"
Guy on the phone: "OK, Spaghetti with meatball"
Boyfriend: "No, no, spaghetti with PESTO"
Guy: "OK, spaghetti with marinara"
Boyfriend: "No, pesto. PESTO"
Guy: "Ok, OK, pesto"

Same deal with trying to order the ravioli. And then, before my boyfriend could explain that we wanted to pay with a card, they guy just hung up. He had to call back, and it wasn't until someone else was put on the phone that everything got sorted. 

I thought the pasta was a bit expensive ($10 compared to $8.60 at Pasquale's), but when it came I saw why. The box was packed TO THE BRIM with pasta and sauce. My boyfriend's ravioli was pretty awesome. There was a lot of fennel in the sauce (which isn't really my thing), but the raviolis themselves were really good and were cooked well. The issue was my dish: The spaghetti and pesto. 

It was almost like a pesto pasta soup, with what seemed like a pound of pasta in it. That would have been awesome, except that the pesto was extraordinarily bland. It was more like a pesto cream sauce, where that wonderful pesto flavor had been diluted down with the cream. No matter how much salt I added, I couldn't make it taste good. 

If you're going to charge me extra for pesto, make sure I'm actually getting good pesto sauce!
author: Rachel A.

description: I don't know about the pizza's here, but the burritos are pretty good! Even the salsa was on point.
author: Miss C.

description: I was disappointed with the quality/taste of the pizza.  After reading reviews, I decided to try Bravo pizza delivery.  My medium pizza with pepperoni and red onions arrived within one hour and was still warm - so the delivery itself was fine.  Yet, the taste of the pizza was lacking.  The pizza is a not thin crust and is kinda doughy - which is fine and I expected this from reviews and pictures.  But the taste of the dough/crust was bland - without thinking about it, I stopped eating each slice when I got to the crust, and there was plenty of crust since the toppings stopped an inch or so from each edge.  The sauce and cheese were also so-so....nothing offensive, but just okay.  I have no idea what people are raving about, but I'll continue to search for a great tasting pizza with home delivery.
author: Ray S.

description: Since a baby ... this place has been awesome!!! I can write a book about this place!! But if your in the excelsior.... BRAVO IS DA WAY TO GO!!!#
author: Main G.

description: Absolutely delicious pizza and its thick. Yes its a bit pricy but soon you will discover its worth the money. Round Table pizza has went down the hill and they charge a lot. The employees that work there are nice and the waitress is great, she even ask us if we need anything else. I recommend coming here if you want real good pizza, and trust me you will not be disappointed.
author: Nick J.

description: This place is delicious! The first time I went with my husband I was a bit skeptical about him loving this place. The waitress there wS very nice and was very tentative to is. When my husband ordered some chef salad, the size of the chef salad is a very generous portion and it was scrumptious. I especially enjoyed the warm fresh made bread with the salad. When the pizza came, it was so good. It definitely blows any other pizza parlor out of the water. The size of a medium is almost like a large. And the price is reasonable for such freshly made pizza. They also have a menu with dishes and I think the next time I go, I will try some of them.
author: Khatia R.

description: Great family owned Italian pizza restaurant. The family is big into giants and niners so it's a great place to come after a game, or if we're in the area. The salads and pizza are both excellent and it is just a great environment to hang out in with friends and family. The owner always comes around to each table and shoots the breeze a little and checks on the food, but he seems to make everyone feel like old friends. Great place, five stars!
author: Joel H.

description: This is my new pizza spot! I had a customer recently bring us a pizza saying it was one of the best. I happily accepted, I mean who doesnt love free pizza. It was love at first bite!!! The crust is perfect, not over sauced and they use good cheese and quality toppings. It was so good that I ordered it with a friend a few days later and this time I ordered the wings well done..... amazing!!! But what I was also impressed with is that they made their own ranch and it didnt come out of a crappy plastic bag lime most places. All in all if you want good quality food just call this place.
author: Trevor D.

description:
5 stars for the taste and food quality

2 stars for the pricing ($26 for a 3 topping large, but they give you 3 cans of coke even though you dont want or need it)

1 star for the delivery time (over 1 hour 15 minutes on a weds after 830pm.

Overall, great pizza, just overpriced and extremely slow delivery time.
author: Ace C.

description:
My husband and I ordered a pizza for delivery based on the yelp ratings. It arrived about 15 minutes late, but looked and smelled delicious. The garlic bread was light, soft, & fluffy on the inside, & had a perfectly crusty crust. The pizza was too thick for my taste but seemed well prepared.

However, that night, and the next morning, we had diarrhea, & Bravo's was the only food we'd shared. I am pretty sure that it was what made us sick. We won't be ordering from here again.
author: Amanda H.

description:
I give Bravo Pizza 3.5 stars.  They are one of the few places that will deliver to my house.  I called around 12:45pm on a Saturday and ordered a pizza.  The guy that answered the phone was polite and courteous.  He also spoke fluent English and didn't have a heavy accent most pizza joint workers have, which is nice because I didn't have to guess what they were saying.  The pizza arrived in about 45 minutes and to my surprise, came with 2 free soda cans.  

The pizza itself was pretty good.  I ordered the "South of the Border" but added pepperoni and mushrooms and substituted their hot link sausage with regular Italian sausage.  I guess it's not really South of the Border anymore...  The crust is really thick but had a really good crunch to it with just the right amount of toppings and sauce.  The jalapeños actually had a pretty decent kick.  If they made the crust a little thinner, I would be a bigger fan.  Maybe they can offer options for crust - thin, regular, thick. 

I'll definitely order from them again.
author: Diana V.

description:
I love this place, but they dropped the ball on me. This is for their customer service, not the pizza.

 On my way back from LA. after a long drive I wanted some pizza so as soon as I got in to South San Francisco I place my order, small pepperoni, sausage and mushroom. 

They told me to pick it up in 45 minutes I get there and pay. Got on my car and opened it to grab a slice and I see pineapple and olives on my pizza, I was like WTF!!! Went back inside and told them 

Guy at counter: "oh I messed it up with a delivery" 

he gave me another pie from the delivery stack, I checked it in front of him and 3 slices were all on top of each other 

Guy at counter: " Blank stare, oh is to big to fit on the box that's why i like that" 

Me: " you couldn't get a bigger box??" 

I took it anyway since I was supper hungry, but I saw no mushrooms told the guy, he then proceeded to pull the cheese of the pizza with a fork to show me that the mushrooms were inside, but no mushroom 

Guy at counter: " I don't want to mess it up" 

Me: "it's already messed up, 

Guy at the counter: "what do you want me to do" 

Me: "I want my money back since I don't want nor did I order what you are giving me and now I'm so freaking mad, that I don't feel like eating anymore" 

Got my money back with no apology, really no apology!!!!!!!!!!!!! I walked out mad as hell and took my money else where. 

My advice to all, check your pizza before you walk out and make sure is what you want, not what Bravos thinks you want!!!!
author: Vanessa L.

description: You haven't had pizza if you haven't eaten Bravos! Perfect every time! Dine in, carry out you can't go wrong.
author: Nicole M.

description: I love this place the best pizza in the neighborhood! Family orientated, good customer service, and Bravos always supports the kids
author: Joanna B.

description:
I love this place!!!!

Not the prettiest place, but it's unique. I think we all need to eat some greasy pizza dipped in ranch sauce every once in awhile. There's just something about a mean slice of pizza and beer, and it just so happens that I prefer to do it here sometimes.

Waitresses aren't trying to impress anyone, you know they're just there to get the job done, no more no less.

Pricing is just like any other pizza place but you get a nice vew of geneva ave from the window seats in the restruant. I enjoy having the option of watching people at bus stops while i'm pigging out.
author: Neek W.

description:
I love love love there authentic pizza and pastas! They give really large portion that can feed a family of four with the best prices haha 

I come here pretty often all the way from Oakland to have there delicious meatballs and ravioli. For some reason it was didn't taste right and the supervisor took care of it by either bringing me out new ones or taking it off the bill. Since they were the same batch he was happily to waived it off. Awesome customer service!!
author: Vannara B.

description:
The service was good (free sodas are cool) but they did take an hour to deliver, and the cost was not too bad (but not a steal either). The pizza was just ok for me! The spaghetti and ravioli w/t meat balls was yummy. Bread was amazing. So I think for now they get 3 stars. I will order from them again and next time skip the pizza (I had the #3) and shoot for the entrees!

I will say they are pretty damn good, just need to try more from them before I start raving! :0)
author: Bella B.

description: Called for a large 'almost everything' yesterday.  They estimated it would take an hour and 20 minutes to deliver, but got it to us in an hour.  Tons of cheese and other toppings, no skimping, got what we paid for - good pizza.
author: elizabeth o.

description: So far one of the best pizzas ive tried so far in san Francisco. Im shockingly dismantled from the flavor the ingridients give once you take the first watery bite and make love to the slice of pizza and get like x123445 mouthgasms from the delicious bite, desperately craving for more. Id definately recommend this place for pizza lovers. This is a must try!
author: Jose L.

description:
What makes a pizza good? Lots of cheese on soft dough to me.  

We ordered 2 large pizzas. They were huge! Lots of melty cheese and I am fantastically happy with it. 

The dough must have garlic on it b/c it smelled like garlic bread in the car.  Am definitely going back to Bravo's!
author: AhLin C.

description: My family and I went to have dinner here on Friday night and 2 of us got really sick, I threw up the whole night and my mom got really bad stomach pains... Sorry but it was horrible and I don't think I'll be back.
author: B L.

description: Pretty good value: ordered 2 giant pizzas, hot wings, a salad, marinated mushrooms and garlic bread all for $80. Food was good! They even threw in a 6 pack of coke. Only two minor things: they forgot the mushrooms on one pizza and when they delivered they called me from the street and I had to come down.
author: Nicole O.

description:
Bravo's is the kind of pizza I used to love in my college days - thick, stretchy cheese and loaded with toppings. The slices are so heavy, you need two hands to pick it up or else it will flop over. And it leaves that orange greasy residue on your hands. You know what I mean. It's a "man's man" kind of pizza.

But now that I'm older, I just can't handle all the grease and cheese. Don't get me wrong, I LOVE cheese. But cheese is only one dimension - I like to be able to taste the sauce and appreciate each ingredient without the cheese overwhelming everything, as is the case at Bravo.

But if you live by the motto "more is more" (rather than less is more), you'll love Bravo Pizza. 

As for me, I'm pretty sure that continuing to eat this pizza will inevitably make me lactose intolerant.
author: Mariela D.

description:
I actually accidentally ordered from Bravo around 1AM after clubbing. I was looking up places on my phone and picked one that I thought I remembered... but when we went to pick it up, it was not at that place. So I checked my phone and figured out that it was this place. 

We picked up the pizzas which smelled amazing and took them back to my house. We got a large pepperoni and something else (it seems I have the tendency to only remember half of the pizzas I order while drunk). The cheese was honestly amazing. It had that perfect stereotypical stringiness and unbelievably flavorful. The rest of the pizza was rock solid but the cheese was off the charts.

The pizza was actually delicious and the price wasn't bad.
author: Stephen S.

description: Hands down best pizza in the Bay Area!
author: Mariah M.

description: Deelicious pizza! The best is the bbq whole chicken roasted and cut in pieces. Comes with veggies and spaghetti and/or ravioli!  Street parking isint that bad around the surrounding side streets. I like the cozy OG Italian eatery vibe and the waitstaff too! One of my favorite classic San Francisco spots
author: Oscar S.

description:
We ordered Bravo's Pizza one night around 1AM after drinking and enjoying the night at a friends house. It took roughly an hour at least for the driver to find the house we were at since navigating around St Francis Woods is generally difficult, but they were very cooperative in delivering to areas that far and confusing. 

We ordered a simple cheese pizza and pepperoni, both large. It may have been my buzzed taste bud receptors but the pizza was relatively delicious. The cheese was melting off the crust and tasted rich and there was a good balance of cheese and tomato sauce. The crust was alright, but overall with the delivery guy being being very friendly, the price very reasonable ($40 for two very large pizzas) and the taste satisfying, Bravo Pizza was delicious and would definitely order again although there are still many other better pizza places out there but four stars for being open real late and friendly at that time!
author: Jesus A.

description:
Best pizza ever! Boo to all of you pizza snobs.  

Bravo's is plain good ol' simple pizza.  You don't need all the fancy toppings and spices when you just want a delicious filling pizza.

Bravo's is the cheesiest pizza and they are not stingy on the toppings.  The sauce to cheese ratio is perfection.  They give you good portions at reasonable prices.

If you like designer pizza, this place isn't for you.  Move along.
author: Eleanor L.

description: After an hour and a half of public transportation disaster, I showed up just as they were closing, starving. The guy at the counter saw my disappointment and threw me some bread and salami, which were delicious, and for that they get 5 stars. I look forward to trying their food.
author: Dan L.

description: THIS is a MAGICAL place that should NEVER change. It reminds me of a pizzeria when I was a kid. Old fashioned to the max, great for groups, great prices and quality and staff. YES! I go there after rehearsal sometimes with the guys (Golden Gate Men's Chorus.) Get the family salad - trust me.
author: Aaron W.

description: The only place that has customer service as bad as this place is Comcast.  Can't even a place a simple order without some rude remark and crappy attitude.  Maybe I was just unlike the last two times I've called since my gf and i never had this problem before with them until recently.
author: Mario S.

description: Just called this place for delivery. He said it would take an hour and a half. Seriously? I don't know if I will ever taste their food. I'm not waiting an hour and a half for delivery from anywhere.
author: Joanna H.

description: This is probably the worst pizza I've had in SF. I live close by so my husband and I gave it a chance. The pizza crust was so thick and had no flavor. The sauce tasted like it was from a can and the cheese was like rubber. It was not cheap either!! We ordered a large with 4 toppings and it was $30!! Also, we live about 3 blocks away and delivery took over an hour. I am giving our leftovers to a homeless person.
author: Jeanette H.

description:
Their pizzas are delicious!!! Their toppings are simple but just enough to give you the taste you need for great pizza. 

Had delivery a few times and dined in once. The atmosphere will OK and their service is alright. I would keep with the delivery style. Reasonable prices, and great portions.
author: Care B.

description: Was in the mood for old school Italian and this place totally fit the bill.  Quiet Saturday at 1:30 pm but the food (fettuccine Alfredo, eggplant parm, spag with clams) was freshly made, delicious and huge portions.  The homemade bread and salad dressings added to a great meal.   Super friendly service.  Don't let the somewhat run down interior turn you away, a great neighborhood place for great Classic Italian dishes.
author: Erica C.

description: I am from Stockton and my fiance bought some pizza at this place because he was craving some while we were visiting San Francisco.It was one of the best we ever had! My fiance even called right after taking the first bite to compliment on it! This place it a must go for pizza in the SF area!!!
author: Esbeydi V.

description: When a native San Franciscan tells you this place is the best pizza in SF, maybe you just have your hopes set too high.  The pizza was fine, but it's not "the best" pizza I've ever had.  It's not even in the top ten best pizzas I've ever had.  I like Zachary's, Little Star, and Patxi's much better than this place.  Oh well.
author: Corey F.

description:
I've loved this pizza since I was 5 years old (5 is the earliest I can remember)...if not younger.  As far as i know my parents have been eating here since they were in high school back in the 80s. My dad says that in his hayday, while playing baseball for McAteer, he could eat a large pizza with a 2L of Coke and still have room for more.  Healthy? Not really, but what did he know, he was 17.  

I love the sauce, crust and the fact that most of the toppings are under the cheese...as opposed to on top.  The cheese is chewy/stretchy and tasty! The house salad is average, but the italian dressing is sooo good.  I dip my crust in it, if I haven't eaten it all.  

I truly appreciate that they deliver all the way to my house, near SFGH, at no extra charge.  It is quite a ways away, and the pizza is as if it was just out of the oven when it gets to my house, and not like its been in a car for 20 mins. Crazy, dont know how they do it.  But I like it!   As has been mentioned, they give free cans of soda with the pizza, and french bread with the salad.
author: Lesliegh H.

description:
i have been coming here and ordering delivery from here since the early 70's. I moved nearby about 3 years ago and ordered delivery from here and found the appearance nice and lots of toppings but no flavour. My daughter ordered  a rew months after that and found the same thing to be true.
  Last Saturday night my wife and I dined at the restaurant. Everyone was friendly and the service was good. When the pizza arrived it looked very good however once again it lacked flavour.
  I use to love the pizza from here but now can not go back. There are many other pizza parlors within a few blocks.
  I wish it was as good as it used to be so i could patronize their restaurant but I can not
author: Biggwally K.

description:
Called in my order at 6:03 pm. Pizza arrived at 7:45 pm. Operator took down the incorrect address after I repeatedly told him my house number. I call in at 7:20 asking what happen to the one hour service, guy tells me its only been 50 min WTF??!! and than dude tells me pizza will be there in five minutes. LIar!

The pizza: taste exactly like the Pizza Hut take home hot & ready pizzas. The crust had no taste and was dry. The cheese didn't even have that gooey separation you'd expect from the other local pizza joints in the neighborhood. Visually, it looked like the pizza you get from target. Still can't believe I paid $23 for a large one topping. 

Overall: They get one star for the free soda.
author: Benjamin M.

description: This place has great pizza! It does take a while to get to you,, but when it does it is still hot and very delicious.  They even throw in sodas. However the thin crust  seems to have less topping than the regular.   It is a little pricey , but its definitely worth it.  Definitely one of the best pies in San Francisco!
author: Dannie A.

description:
If you wanna nice, huge, hot, and fresh pizza that will fill those late munchie cravings. Either from a night out boozing with the boys, clubbing with the ladies, or just kicking back with the homies hehe...puff puff!!! 

Then come to this place right here. "It's the bomb baby!" hahaha
author: Marvel M.

description:
Definitely something magical just went down at my house.  Approximately every Wednesday night I stay in and gorge myself while watching Netflix (in particular my favorite TV show Reno 911).  Anyway, I worked really hard today and decided I would reward myself with pizza.  In my neighborhood its Little Joe's or Bravo.  I've had relatively basic food at both of these joints before.  
But as I said, tonight was magic.  
I ordered a veggie pizza (no onions, no cheese, extra red sauce) and a greek salad for delivery. I asked for the feta and blue cheese dressing on the side.  I waited for my order while watching a show I'd never seen before called Bob's Burgers.  I called my mom.  I let my hunger build.
Suddenly, there was the doorbell and Mr. Bravo was waiting downstairs with a box of pizza, covered by another box top full of salad/bread/(free)soda/dressing/cheese/etc.  I laughed right away, and he started laughing too, because we both knew damn well that this fatty feast was a meal for one.  Anyway, without shame I forked over $30, and without shame I went right into the feta on my way back upstairs.  
With glee in my heart I delved into mouthwatering homemade bread, which I promptly dipped into the homemade blue cheese dressing.  I am always glad I live alone, but never more in that tender moment.  Then I went straight for my first bite of hot veggie pizza, which I had ordered with fresh garlic added.  Mamma Mia!  Where is my boyfriend when I need to lay a sloppy wet one on him?  With hands shaking and heart racing I managed to get pizza, bread, and salad onto a plate, which was truly an olympic feat since both hands and mouth were busy stuffing food down my face.  I finally made it back to my seat so I could do my favorite thing in the whole world: eat an amazing meal while watching Netflix.  Some might call it a vice, but I call it a festival of carnal pleasure.  
Thank you, Bravo, for not only getting my order 100% correct over the phone, but also for the free soda, which, although I probably won't drink it, made me feel like I was a sweepstakes winner.  You will be remembered as part of a brave and time-honored ritual, and you will be summoned again soon.  The pizza gods have smiled on us both.
author: Trixie R.

description: Bravo's Pizza is all about the pizza. This oldschool joint had been around before I was born and has no interest in remodeling the place to make it look more modern. Those posh trendy gourmet pizza places that opened up recently are no competition to Bravo's homely vibe and excellent customer service. You can definitely tell that the servers are down to earth and want to make their customers happy eating pizza!
author: Karla M.

description:
Bravos pizza is not that good, the pizza is greasy. Too greasy. 

I remember ordering delivery, and the cardboard was DRENCHED in greasy-ness. I know pizza isn't supposed to be healthy, but this is just crazy! :O
author: Sophia G.

description: One of my favorite pizza spots in SF.  Cheesy and delicious. You go there for the pizza, not the decor.
author: Damon W.

description: Delicious pizza. The meat was great. They sent a free coke too. I'm a customer now...
author: David M.

description:
Pizzas are so gooood!! I love the crust, so doughy and crispy. Don't take this home and eat it,unless you live walking distance! Plop down and get the salad with HOMEMADE ranch or 1000, some kick ass garlic bread and your fave pizza and your good to go! 
Staff is old school nice! They are open late for those late night after party cravings. They have "bomb ass chicken wings" according to the hubby. The New York steak with sauce and mushrooms is good but too much sauce, just ask 4 less. My lil guy and I share the steak because it comes with a bunch of broccoli and carrots & pasta. They could improve on the meatball sandwich, according to my son. The bread was too crispy and the meatballs were just the same meat sauce on my pasta.  :(
Oh I must not forget about the bread that is served once you are seated!! YUMMY! So fresh and warm. 
Go online and get a coupon, it's always expired (it's not updated) BUT they will always take it. They have for all the countless times we go :)
They have been here for a long time so they must be doing something right! It's cool that my hubby & I came here with our parents and now we are bringing our kids!
author: Ale G.

description: The one thing I continue to come here for. The spaghetti. Absolutely delicious. When I'm drinking and just hanging out, this is the place I'm craving. Delivery can be a bit ridiculous, so I recommend placing your order for pick up. Guy who is always working the front has a bit of dry humor, always a treat if you can enjoy pure sarcasm at its finest. Have tried the wings, surely will never order those again.
author: Lucy P.

description:
I showed up here last night, around 11pm after finding parking in the dodgy neighbourhood. I ordered a small and was served by the owner. They do not have a wine list, a shame for an Italian place, but that aside... The food was very good, if a tad heavy. I went home and woke up with an upset stomach -- I blame the cheese, as I do have a slight lactose intolerance. 

If they were to relocate to a more, uhh, hospitable neighbourhood, I'd go more often. I'd like to skip getting vomit on my rear window, many thanks! ;)

--- UPDATE ---
I got take-away again on Thursday and it was brilliant. I guess it wasn't the cheese that upset my stomach.
author: Hasan D.

description: GREAT pizza - recommend the thick crust!  GREAT owner and kids run the place.
author: Elaine S.

description: I've been coming here ever since I played little league baseball when i was 9 years old at Crocker Park exactly 24 years ago. And to me it my San Francisco Excelcior District favorite. Come on by and give it a try.
author: Ignacio O.

description:
I didn't have really much to eat while I was in San Fransisco. So my friend and I decided to yelp Pizza. And Bravo Pizza was near my apartment at the time. We went to try it out and oh was it was filling. The sauce was pretty good, what caught our attention was the super big spaghetti they had, but we didn't order it cause it was wayyyy too much for two people to eat! 
Although parking was a pain to find, it was really worth our while. I would recommend this place. 
service is friendly here and the enviroment makes you feel like you are in a classic American - Italian movie.
author: Vicky H.

description:
Good Friday, I tried to be good...but gave into a Bravo's Veggie Pizza.  Man, I'd been craving Bravo's since I moved back to San Francisco.  I was waiting and anticipating a thick crunchy crust with the rest of the Bravo goodness, I was so bummed.  It was only ok.  It didn't live up to the hype I had built up in my head.  Whether it was due to hunger or just fragmented college memories glued together with all the excess cheese that eventually hit me late in the night, I was disappointed.

I don't know whether my taste buds just sucked  when I was in college and have finally matured now, or has the Bravo's quality gone down in the last 10 years.  All I know is, that pizza was not the best and I can't say I'll go back anytime soon.
author: elizabeth c.

description: I love their pizza! My favorite is the "world famous bravo" and I add pineapple to my order. It's easy to make an order on the phone and I always go pick up. They've never messed up my order and the food is consistently delicious, fresh, and I have leftovers for the next day with a small size. They don't skimp on anything. Come here rather than a chain if you want good pizza with a thick pillowy crust that's much better than the frozen flatbread you can get at the grocery store.
author: Nancy C.

description: Pizza is good but that's it! First review on yelp is this I found this place on yelp so I created an account just to share my experience. Waiting for a pizza that was ordered more than a hour and a half ago! I just called and the guy that answered the phone just said its leaving with the next driver. That's it! I asked him about how long and he said he didn't know and hung up. Never again!!!!!
author: Sam A.

description: My favorite pizza place in all of san francisco. Everything is homemade. I've been coming here for about 30yrs and the place hasn't changed. They quality is SUPER!! The decor is the same as well. They have never changed the boothes to they are lumpy.. Doesn't bother me at all. My family and I are here at least once a week.
author: Ayana K.

description: I love Bravos Pizza! Especially after a drunken night in the mission! They stay open late to satisfy your craving till 1:30 am. Bravos is good anytime! Drunk or sober. ;)
author: Venus R.

description:
This place brings back happy memories of when I was a kid. If you're looking for pizza to fill your stomach, you have to stop by this place. I'll admit, it's not for everyone, but it's definitely for most pizza lovers! The pizza is saucy without being soggy and nasty, and SUPER CHEESY!! For all the cheese lovers, there's a nice thick layer of cheese for you to enjoy. The All Meat and the Bravo Special is my favorite. The rest of the food is good too, but I obviously, Pizza is the center of attention at this restaurant.

They toss in a few sodas when you order pizza to go, but for what they charge, they really should give you a few more cans than they do; but for the amount of stuff the dump on top of this pie, most pizza-places would call it "extra", so really, you get what you pay for.

On my way to pick up the Xtra-Large All Meat right now!! Can't wait... yumm....
author: Jason L.

description: Thick, thick crust. Wow. First time ordered pepperoni and mushroom and by the 2nd time we learned our lesson and ordered with more sauce which totally made the difference. Without the extra sauce the pizza can be tough to eat since it's so dry and thick. Wings (bone in) were nice and spicy but teeny tiny. Prob come here again and try something new.
author: Vanessa C.

description:
Just awful...

the dough tastes old and stale, the sauce was straight up from a can, besides that, the place is dirtyyyy, stay away.
author: Raquel G.

description: They're back! I had to give it another shot. It took me some time to build up the courage or should I rather say forget about the prior disappointment. But I eventually did and I was happy.
author: Rio J.

description: Awesome place.  Great pizza.  The garlic bread was very good too.
author: Jeff L.

description: amazing pizza amazing service. you can't go wrong. ask for ranch and they will selflessly give you a huge tub of it. *drool*
author: Sonya Z.

description:
Long time Bravo fan. The pizza is great! The atmosphere is old school but it's still cozy. The prices are good and did I say the pizza is great! 

When I order pizza here I ask for thin crust the thick is a lil too thick for me. The buffalo wings are not good. It seems like they take them out of a bag and microwave them. Hey well I guess that's y it's called Bravo's Pizza because the pizza is really delicious! The staff is really nice and most of them have been working there for years. Too bad they don't accept ATM cards. Oh yea there's an ATM machine in the place.
author: Shanika M.

description: I'm a new regular here, but not for the pizza. I dine in for the pasta and entres.  Oh yeah, now that's the ticket. Try the veal dishes, the pasta, the chicken, and the New York steak smothered in gravy and mushrooms. All comes with salad with both dressing and fresh bread made right there. The waitress is a sweetheart so make sure to tip her good.
author: Lavina L.

description:
Good Pizza.
I went here at about 5 on a Tuesday, there was no one there (i guess it was a little early for pizza) but the staff was really nice and they even gave me some free soda!
author: Michael D.

description: The pizza is ok. I guess it depends on which kind you order. It's very salty for my taste.
author: arlene d.

description:
Bravo's is a great late night, drunk or sober place to grab some cheap yummy pizza. I found this place through my sisters' ex and loved it ever since. I use to come here at least once a week until I gained so much weight, I just couldn't eat any more until I loose weight. The place is a little hole in the wall but the food is good and service is always friendly. 

We usually order the small (enough for two) with HOT LINK SAUSAGE, and the other half, my usually pepperoni, mushroom, and olives. The pizza is always loaded with lots of cheese and lots of toppings! Their garlic bread with cheese is also yummy. Really huge portion of garlic bread for cheap. The Pizza crust itself is like a sourdough crust.. dip it in some Ranch dressing? So damn good! 

Make sure you bring CASH!
author: Juliane N.

description:
I love this old school SF pizzaria! Consistently great quality and good prices. All sorts of toppings. Fresh, cheesy, thick, hearty, tasty pizza. My #1 hangover choice (LOL)! Dont bother if you're into the foo-foo thin crusted burnt bottom dusty funny topped Amiccis style pizza. Laid back  hole in the wall if you want to eat it there. Nice service. One complaint...cash only...so when I've spend all my cash on cocktails the night before...i opt for Haystack (good but more expensive), or Little Joes, (also good) because they take credit cards.

Free soda with your order=nice touch.
author: Monica T.

description: "If you don't order within three seconds, you will be shot!"  This is the sign at the register...hilarious...Well we took longer than three seconds and survived.  However, we didn't conquer everything we ordered.  Bravo gives the largest portions...I would under-order b/c the portions are so large!  You definitely get your money's worth in regards to quantity.  We ordered 1 spaghetti meat sauce and 1 large half pesto/mushroom, half pepperoni pizza and ate 3/4 pasta and 1/3 of the pizza between the four of us!  The quality is so-so...I would opt not to order the salad in the future (addition to the pasta)...The salad is iceberg lettuce, some onions, one four tomato slices and dressing.  The warm bread served before the meal is the best!!  It is piping hot when it comes out and the butter melts immediately.  If you want to feed a family on a budget, this is the spot!
author: Steph W.

description: This is my kind of place. Not refined and polished, not pretending to be anything other than a great neighborhood pizza joint. The crust of their pizza is enough reason to visit Bravos. Crispy on the outside, doughy inside. Fresh toppings and more cheese than one can hope for! Palate pleasing pizza perfection! On top of the food, the service is very accommodating. Even though this was just my first visit, I felt as though I had been a regular customer for years. Come for the food, stay for the laughs! A must visit when in the Excelsior District.
author: Chris B.

description:
I have been coming here for years, basically since I was old enough to stay out late and get wasted ;). This has been one of my late night dining spots. You don't have to order pizza, I have also had the pasta with clams, veal parmigiana, big bowls of salad, and other items I can't recall. Even though it is greasy I like the pizza sandwich, the bread practically absorbs all the grease and sauce and is sooooo good. With the pizza sandwich you get many ingredients so I recommend eating it with a fork. 

The waitresses are warm and friendly, and the environment feels like a sports bar. An x-large will feed more than 4 people, when I come with my usual four buddies we always have lots of leftovers. The pizza crust is just how I like it- thick, soft, and spongy. Any of the combos are good. I don't think I have ever been disappointed by what I order. 

I have to say, I don't think the area is sketchy or bad like other reviewers have mentioned, but then again that is all kind of subjective.
author: X marks the spot ..

description:
Bravo is seriously one of the best pizza's in the city.  I'm sitting here now and even though I haven't been there in awhile, I can still recall the smell of the lovely xlarge mushroom, sausage and olive I had last.  

Not the east coast thin crust type of pizza, this one packs a punch with it's thick crust.  I've since grown to love thin crust pizza, but Bravo will always hold a warm spot in my tummy.

As for the area being sketchy, puh-leez, don't be such a wimp. It might be considered sketchy if you've moved here from some mid west norman rockwell town, but those of us born and bred here see nothing wrong with crackheads and gangs of kids on the corner - jeez, they're just waiting on the bus, get over yourselves already.
author: Jennifer G.

description:
SOOO I previously rated them 5 stars, but that only applies to dining in! & not really anymore because the last few times we've actually SEEN roaches on our booth & the wall next to us. We've moved so we actually order in now & it's ALWAYS a disaster. 

1. we ask for well done; we get greasy, pale, sad pizza. if it were a person, it'd have jaundice..

2. they never, I repeat NEVER give you cheese & pepper packets. yes. supposedly you have to ask for it when you order (wtf?) & 9 times out of 10, it's always absent. ooh & don't bother asking the drivers either, they don't have any. you think they'd carry some in their car. their fucking pizza delivery car!!!
author: Annette B.

description:
I love that these guys have been around forever and are an Excelsior institution.  

The wings were super scrawny, pretty awful, and a rip-off.

The pasta dishes looked absolutely enormous.

The all-meat pizza we ordered was big and really good -- with the very notable exception of the sausage, which oddly enough, was absolutely flavorless.
author: Adam Z.

description: Crust,sauce,& cheese are good, toppings are ok, could be better quality toppings. Owner is really friendly!
author: Matthew R.

description:
Another place I find here on yelp that I like.We were going to try Gialina out,but decided since this place was open to give it a try.

Bravo is located on Mission near Geneva in SF.You can either dine here,pick up or get it delivered.We were excited to see all the nice reviews so we went on trying this place out with all smiles.

We got a pepperoni,sausage and mushroom pizza.Nice,hot,thick crust,seasoned toppings and tasty.I can't tell you how delicious this pizza tasted.The sauce was flavorful and with a ton of cheese on it too.

Nice customer service,decent prices and again good.

The pizza even tasted good the next day.

The even have hamburgers(hmm) and other dishes that may be worth a try.A simple pizza joint  off of Geneva...that is what I like.
author: Dani D.

description:
Well, let me just say that I have been to Bravo Pizza twice now, and in those two times, it has become my favorite spot for pizza.

Each time I go, it is with two others, and we always start off with the same things....a large bowl of Minestrone Soup and an order of Garlic Bread. The soup is FABULOUS and HOMEMADE. It is hot, tasty, and has a lot of large veggie chunks in it. It is by far one of the better soups from a restaurant. The garlic bread can either have cheese or not, but the portion is overly large. The do not scrimp here. 

The pizza order: an all-meat pizza with pesto instead of tomato sauce. By this point, i usually do not eat the crust, but the pizza itself is wonderful and tasty. 

Plus, the lady that waits on us all the time is really nice and friendly, as well as observant.

So overall, the portions are LARGE, the price is REASONABLE, the service is GREAT, and the taste EXTRAORDINARY. I HIGHLY recommend this place to anyone looking for a good dining experience, as it really is a nice comfortable atmosphere.

YUM!
author: Ruben S.

description:
oh. I forgot that after you clap you have to stand up and yell out...

Braw VOE! Braw Voe! BRAVO!

!!!

you might have to say bravo three times for some odd reason. Don't quote me on that, but I think I've seen it in a Bugs Bunny Episode awhile back and I swear he said it three times. Not sure if there is a significance to how many times you have to say the word...but...if there isn't...you can just ignore this update. Actually just ignore me in general.

(i know. that was just dumb)
author: Romes K.

description: the best pizza i had in the bay, im just so sad i live so far away. i drive 45 mins just to eat at this place. Thick crunchy frenchbread crust with ample amount of cheese and toppings. Good hang over food.
author: Lan V.

description:
I, like Marciano, have been ordering pizza from Bravo forever and a day. Their pizza is that thick crust that some East Coasters hate, but is chewy and a delight when matched with the overcheesed topping. They will deliver, and thankfully so, over to where I live over past Vis Valley, but it's always best when you pick it up yourself. Just remember, don't sit in the car with it somewhat crooked...all the thick cheesearama will slide to one side. YES I have done this before! I don't want to hear about it!

The pizza will definitely leave you satisfied and you won't be begging for more because you'll probably fall asleep after eating two slices. Excellent work, so a Bravo to Bravo.

Maybe because I grew up here, that I don't think it's in a bad area of town, but it's definitely not the place to post up outside and have a smoke. Call it in, drive up to the front door (yes it's a red zone for busses, but you'll be in and out), and grab/pay/say thanks and run back to your car. You can also circle the block too while someone runs in to get your pizza, so no worries, friends!
author: Charlene L.

description:
We are always trying to find good places in excelsior. Went on Yelp and Bravo got really good reviews. However, we were quite disappointe. 

The pizza was average at best.  The crust was really thick and quite chewy but lacked taste. In fact, the whole pizza lacked taste. My husband and I will eat about anything but we each had one slice and ended up tossing the rest. Their only redeeming quality was that they gave us free soda (and that will always put my husband in a good mood). Maybe Bravo was having a bad day because we were not impressed.
author: L A.

description:
One of the best pizza you can get if you live near Geneva&Mission/City College area.  Thick crust pizza with hearty portions of cheese and meat.

Now mind you its in a somewhat "bad area" of town but it just looks that way.  Just don't go out there at night or past 9pm.  I recommed getting the Bravo Combo pizza.
author: Buddy R.

description: So to start off, I have been a customer of Bravo's for many years. Of course only by delivery, it's located in the mission so parking is practically a myth. I enjoy their product a lot! But if they can be given a class on customer service they might grow rather than be just that pizzeria next to the bus stop! I understand after years of dealing with all types of customers must employees/owners become real cynical about the customers but cmon now! I don't need a thank you but its just common courtesy!!! I mean what if you guys came with the pizza and I just open the door grabbed it and slammed the door in their face without a tip? Its not like the tip is required, its simply common courtesy!!!
author: Peter G.

description: I love Bravo's!!  Believe or not, being a San Francisco native, I was just introduced to Bravo's maybe 3-4 months ago.  For two people, a small pep is more than enough and only $14.00--with delivery fees.  Everything from the dough to the crust to the cheese is absolutely fresh and enjoyable.  Delivery times can be a bit long, but hey, I guess if you plan ahead and order early, it's not a big deal.
author: Cin W.

description:
The place we order pizza from!!!  
http://www.bravopizzany.com/
You have to ask for red pepper and Parmesan or you don't get any... it doesn't come automatically with your order.

Within the last year, we've given up on North Beach and Venice.  We found Little Joe's  to be way too salty and expensive.  Cable Car took too long to deliver. We couldn't find the extra cheese on the pizza from Venice... also they put their pepperoni under the cheese, which irritated my husband.

It's amazing... When you ask for light sauce, it is light sauce! For Bravo, extra cheese isn't a subtle thing... you can tell it has extra cheese. 

Bravo gets us our pizza in about 1/2 an hour.  An extra large pizza with extra cheese costs $23. I also can't believe they are so generous to give us three free cans of Coke (or diet Coke if you request it) with the extra large order. My husband and I can be eating the same pizza for three days (reheated in a toaster oven or in a cast iron pan)!!!!
author: Priscilla L.

description:
One of my friends had her birthday party here a year ago. We all live nearby and she was surprised to hear that I haven't ever been to Bravo. She has frequently come here and the owners all know her by name; they greeted us very friendly, as if we were their family (even myself and her friends who don't have that frequent-visitor relationship with them). I thought that was simply fantastic; we were also seated quickly, which was definitely a plus.

We ordered a lot of pizzas and they overheard us, as we asked the birthday girl what she wanted to do after our birthday lunch for her. The owner came out and surprised us all with free drinks and free bread; it was just a fantastic gesture, yet we were in for a bigger surprise. He came by and casually asked us if we were finishing up, we answered in the affirmative and five minutes later he came out with some ice cream with a candle lit on top! The pizzas, bread, and the ice cream (there was a lot for everyone to share) was simply great. Now I'm a die-hard Little Joe's fan along with my family but I must say: Bravo, you guys rock! We left a nice tip and we also came by with a thank you card just for that extra uumph of customer service.
author: Rick C.

description:
Bravo Pizza is one of the best Pizza joints around.  I've been ordering pizza since 1985.  The pizza has always been consistent and tasty.  Just thinking about the pizza always gets my mouth watery.  The environment is like a sports bar that is nice and old.

The price may be high, but it is well worth it.  Lastly, I highly recommend that you eat there or pick it up yourself because the delivery takes FOREVER...I live 5 blocks away and it took 120 mins for delivery.  After that moment, I've decided to walk my fat ass to Bravo.
author: Chan M.

description:
Moving sucks.  I moved to the Excelsior and have had to try all types of places to eat.  My "usual joint" is now 3 freeway exits away but still too far in terms of going out in my PJ's!

Yelpers, not sure why this place has 4 stars!  The food was mediocre.  
There was a coupon online for buy 2 pastas, get one free!  So we ordered:

The Big One!  (Ravioli, Spagetti and Meatballs)
Lasagna
Large 4 topping pizza
The total charge came out to be just under $40.  
Thats with a pasta for free.  I was a bit confused about prices, and when I got there I asked, and the charges online are not updated.  WHAT!  Okay, whatever.  We took the food home, the food was not worth the money we paid.   

Yelpers - save your hard earned money.  Go somewhere else.
author: Alice E.

description:
Nothing special.

The crust was a tad doughy and very much just sort of... there. it added absolutely nothing. Otherwise it was just sort of below average: I didn't loathe it, but I have little to no desire to ever come back again.

In terms of major chains I'd rate it above Domino's, but still below Pizza Hut and c'mon... shouldn't a local place be able to do better than a national chain like that?
author: Mark S.

description:
Just found out about Bravo Pizza on Yelp and since it was highly rated, I ordered a half Best of Mission and half Veggie, and the vote is in: MEDIOCRE!

I am certainly not from NY to claim to be a pizza connoisseur but I understand what tastes good and what doesn't and let me tell you this place is quite average.

The price as somebody mentioned is not that cheap; our pizza was about $30.

Anyway, it seems Pizza is really a personal choice and you gotta see for yourself how you like it.
author: Lo F.

description:
meh. this is thick crust, doughy pizza. If you've had pizza at Haystack Pizza, you've had Bravo's pizza. There is no difference. None. Zippo. I had flashbacks.

We decided to eat in and was treated very well by the waitress. She was sweet and attentive, and even call us "young ladies" as we drank our 1/2 pitcher of beer. yay!  

We ordered, 1/2 order of spaghetti + meat sauce, small Bravo combo, & garlic bread.  Food to table was fast -- spaghetti & bread came first, while the pizza arrived 10 minutes later.  As I mentioned, this is a very similar pie to Haystack--which if you read my reviews is not my favorite.

Interior of the place is old school family pizza parlor. Think red, white, & green themes, coloring book dinosaur themed placemats, red vinyl booths & family dining. Bravo is a throwback to your youth. There is 1 TV ( not a sports bar) that had the giants pre-season game.

This is a CASH ONLY place and cell phone use is prohibited.

And about the neighborhood-- It's not sketchy. You don't deserve to live in a city if you can't handle a colorful 'hood.
author: Pea H.

description: Long time Bravos fan, Pete (the owner) and Florence (I think that's her name) know me and family, my folks drive once a month from Concord and me every 2 months for girls night out in the city, yummy pizza, cash only, and delicious salads served with thick, huge slices of french bread, the pizza sandwich is also a great filler and can be shared by two with a pitcher of beer or soda!
author: Veronica S.

description:
I've tried NY style pizza. Ray's, and some other one. Trash.  I've tried Chicago Deep dish, Giordano's. It was actually EXCELLENT.
But no pizza i've ever tried is as good as Bravo Pizza. We always get the "#1" which is the bravo special. Pepperoni, meatballs, mushrooms and onions. They have a bunch of other pizzas, but this is the best one. They also sell a lot of other italian dishes, none of which i care for. This is the best pizza in the city. Geneva pizza, Roma Pizza, not even Blondie's off Market can compare. The inside is kind of old though, i dont know why , considering how many people eat there. The pizzas are priced well, my mom says the coffee is always good.. The sauteed mushrooms and chef salad are heeella good. This is the best pizza ever.
author: A C.

description: When I was growing up Bravo's pizza was one of the places you went to after dancing all night at California Hall or La Fuente.....that being said the last time I was at Bravo's was probably 1985.  I grew up with the city and never looked back.  Well thanks to yelp and a friend of mine who is a transplant, she asked me about Bravo's one day.  I told her it was an old school pizza place but haven't been in years.   She looked on yelp and said we have to try it, this place gets great reviews.   So we go one night after work in our uptight work clothes, and when I walk in I can't believe that the place looks exactly like it did in the 70s and 80s.  The booths are all taped up and the walls and pictures have seen better days.   However that doesn't turn me off it.  We sit in a booth that is so old my friend says there is a pole going up her butt.  You have to position yourself just the right way to find padding on the seat.   A nice young boy/man takes our order which is the Greek Salad and the World Famous Pizza.   Since it's a Thursday night the place isn't that busy so the waiter is very attentive.  He brings us warm bread (why can't all restaurants warm their bread), butter, extra plates and napkins, and the Greek Salad with 2 different dressings we requested.  The salad is huge and they are not cheap with any of the ingredients.  It was EXCELLENT.  The salad was so big we had a lot left over to take home.   Then the pizza comes....piping hot - again not cheap with the ingredients - lots of cheese, sausage, etc.  The first bite is pure heaven.   I'm thinking what a dumbass I've been for waiting over 20 years to come back to Bravos.    I bring the left overs to my Mom who was born and raised in North Beach and she tells me how delicious everything is and wants to know where it come from.  I tell her Bravo's and she can't believe it "That hole in the wall on Mission St"  Yup the same one.    I go to many pizza places in the city, Little Star, Defina, Flour and Water, North Beach Pizza, Paradise in West Portal, etc.  I also travel a lot for work and pleasure and have had pizza in New York City, Brooklyn, Chicago, Spain, Italy, etc.    Not all pizzas are created equal and each has its own crust, style etc.   But Bravo's is definitely in my top 5 list and considering I still live in the city and they will deliver to my home I'm definitely not going to wait another 20 years to go back.   Bravo's is old school, good home cooking!!
author: P S.

description: They have the best pizza around. Seriously, if you like cheese then you have to try it! I've also eaten in the restaurant and my only criticism is that they didn't have a server taking care of drinks early on. We didn't get our beers until the food came. Not a good business move but, hands down the best pizza in SF.
author: Airika A.

description:
I don't know, but I love this place.

When I lived in the city, across the street from Balboa Park, I found myself here for those late night muncies or the casual gathering of neighborhood buddies. Located right at the junction of Geneva and Mission, this place is not hard to find.

Parking can very well be a challege if driving. You'll solely have to depend on street parking. And along Mission, sometimes that can be bummer.

Its so inviting once inside. You lose all that tension and stress once the smell of the pizza's slowly cooking away in the ovens attacks your nostrils which just furthers your hunger, LOL. No really. 

It feels "Homey". Like you can order then sit down and chop it up with whoever you are there with and just relax. I don't know but I find the booths seating extremely comfortable. The seat sinks in and cradles your bum almost like a Tempur Pedic mattress, but that's probably because they are old, LOL!

The pizza is great. Full of flavor, fluffy, and plenty to go around. They don't hold back on the toppings either. They'll fill that sucker up!

I need to come back. Mabye I'll rile up a few old buddies that are still around and we'll go here for a reunion eat and drink.

Pitcher + Pizza = Good Times!
author: Jay V.

description:
