Just moved to the Outer Mission, where there's about 22 pizza joints running north on Mission.  I've only tried about 5 places, but Bravo has topped the list so far.  

The crust is a little thicker than I like (NY style is my pref), BUT the sauce is primo, non-acidic, and not overly sweet.  Good ratio of cheese and sauce too!


P.S. far as I can tell, they DON'T put onions on the bottom of the cheese.  Maybe it's a freebee if you're really really drunk.
author: Jeffrey S.

description: Thick crust, late night, as a good a pizza as you can get! The burger is big and tasty too!
author: Roger P.

description: Man, this place holds a special place in my heart. Having grown up in the Excelsior district, we've ordered from Bravos too many times to count. There are quite a few pizza joints in the area that deliver, but none deliver the fresh, delicious flavors that these Marios produce. Their pizza has fresh toppings and the crust is perfect. Not too skinny, not too doughy and big, but just right! And if you order a large, you get free sodas too! I can't speak about the experience of eating there, because I never have. But if you live in the area, order a pizza from Bravo. You won't be disappointed!
author: Axel G.

description:
I've been coming to Bravo's now for about a year after moving into the Crocker-Amazon suburbs. 

Great Pizza and free sodas if you take out, good entrees and dinner options, beer by the pitcher and decent red wine, a cozy and family-owned atmosphere, and HUGE portions!

I'm not kidding folks... the entrees are HUGE. Seriously, you could get a spaghetti with mushrooms or a chicken marinara to share with your date, and you'd STILL have leftovers for a big lunch.

great prices, good food, friendly staff... I have no complaints with Bravo Pizza!
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
We have ben really pleased with Bravo Pizza.  

They have been great on the phones, the orders have never been wrong (so far), their own Ranch dressing is delicious, their homemade bread is also great and the portions are really really generous.  

They don't screw up when you have a special request (like leave off the onions please) and we love the way the order comes packed to you.  I think Bravo is a good value and we usually order the Chicken Parmasian Dinner and  the Greek Salad and it's always tasty and more than we can eat in one sitting. Leftovers! Yea!!
author: Karen L.

description: I love Bravos they are GREAT!! ITS A MUST if you find yourself on that side of town. I love it. Pete's the best and always remembers your name and face. Thanks for the loving atmosphere.
author: Veronica V.

description:
Bravo pizza is definitely A-OK.  That's about it.  It used to be better, and it's a good place to go in and sit down and share a pitcher of beer over a pizza.  The pizza always seems better in the restaurant, but the aforementioned pitcher of beer might have some effect on that assessment.  They've got plenty of room and the service is laid back and friendly.  Really though, the last couple pizzas I've gotten here have been just alright, one had a pretty weak crust.

It used to be my usual delivery place, but lately Geneva Grill has been getting the call.
author: Adrian L.

description:
Here's my breakdown for Bravos Pizza

Pros
Good pizza
Open LATE
Big portions
Free soda with take out pizza

Cons
Cash only, or use their high fee in house ATM machine
Not exactly an all smiles work force
Often too crowded
author: Armando S.

description: This Thanksgiving weekend my family and friends went on a get-away trip to San Francisco to see the lighting of the Christmas tree. That was a crazy experience with crowds of people. Before going we stopped and ate at Bravo's pizza. Bravo's was estalished in 1963. You can watch your pizza being made through their front window.  The inside is nothing to look at, no parking lot, restrooms need some T.L.C.  and don't go into neighborhood after dark. The pizza is delicious, the crust is soft inside but crispy on out, ingredients are chopped and blended into cheese. For sure I will go back! Bravo's is alittle bit of the old world of Italty
author: cindy m.

description: Awesome, family style food and service. I came here to do homework while traffic died. Everyone was extremely friendly, the pizza is great and the minestrone is fantastic!
author: Gina O.

description: If you like your pizza thick with tons of toppings this is your place. Order delivery and they will always throw in some of their fresh baked bread and a soda with your pizza.
author: Mark F.

description: Great number 1 pizza with Pepperoni, meatballs, mushrooms and onions.  Recommended by fellow yelpers.
author: Jim J.

description: After almost burning my self out on Primo's Pepperoni and sausage Pizza we decided to try Bravo. WHAT A GREAT DECISION! Its a little pricey but you get AMAZING toppings and a hot pizza when delivered. I payed 30 dollars for an extra large pie of greatness! Finally a place that has a DECENT pizza! I'm def gonna swap them on our Pizza nights as a regular. I cant stand these other places want to charge extra for toppings and a terrible pizza. Bravos is will worth the money!
author: Jessica T.

description: I've had them a few times. Usually very late at night. Delivery. For when I don't wanna get out of bed, but I'm starved. Or when I'm drunk and starved. Either way, it hits the spot. The pizza though.... I tried some of the pasta and honestly I wasn't a fan. Def. stick to the pizza and it'll be all good! Totes recommend the pesto!
author: Lexie L.

description: This place is my go-to pizza place. If you like extremely cheesy pizza, this is the place to go. It's so thick that I could be full with one slice, but definitely with two slices. It's not the cheapest pizza you can find, but it's also not very expensive. Bottom line, good pizza for a decent price.
author: Krystle A.

description: Great pizza...NY style. Perfect crust and sauce. They deliver, have dine in and take out. So far, my #1 go to place for pizza in SF
author: Paul W.

description: I ordered the hawaiian pizza, wings, salad, and fettucine alfredo. The pizza was absolutely delicious. If you like thick crust, you won't be disappointed. The delivery time was a bit long, 1 hour and 20 mins, but so worth it. The fettucine alfredo was good, not great. However the pasta came with fresh bread that was delicious. The wings were good and their ranch was amazing. They even gave me a free soda that I wasn't expecting. The delivery guy was super nice.
author: Dorian C.

description:
Ick. We just did a taste off at work tonight. Compared Bravo's with Mr. Pizza Man, Domino's and Round Table. Bravo's was the worst (10 of us tasted). There was a toss up between Mr. Pizza Man and Round Table.
The sauce is too sweet on the plain cheese. The pepperoni and mushroom tasted artificial. I actually threw out my slice of pepperoni and mushroom after 2 bites. The crust is actually the thinnest of the pizzas we ordered, contrary to other reports. 
Not worth the take-out. There are plenty of better places.
author: Danica B.

description: Bravos mushroom olive pizza is my comfort food. But don't forget the spaghetti and delicious meatballs and their glorious bread with butter
author: EmmettsGuRL C.

description: This is my spot!!! Everything is hella good and hella BIG! I always have leftovers. Hole in the wall kind of spot but those are my favorites. Even the salads enormous.  Try the cheap red wine, one of my favorites and it really compliments the pizza. Everything is made from scratch. I love the owner too, such a personality.  Pastas are so good and there are daily specials.
author: Sucia H.

description:
My softball team comes here every Friday night after our games and it is theeeee best. 

Great friendly service and very open-arms environment. Nice mixture of large and small booths and a mid sized TV in the corner, usually showing the current Giants/Warriors/Bay Area sports team game. 

Pizza is pretty good but what I normally order is the pasta dishes. They are huge! 95% of all pasta dishes will end up being in take-home boxes. I order the Pete's Special, which is sausage and veggies with a light butter sauce. AWESOME.

Buffalo wings are spiiiiiicy. Seriously. And they usually have Red Hook or Bud Light on tap. And when I go in, the nice waitress will instantly bring me my root beer, no ice. AWESOME. 

Overall, food is very good but the thing that sets the place apart is the experience. Just a great place to be with happy people eating around you.
author: Rich H.

description:
Whether your having a party or small gathering and you want to order pizza for that occasion, call this place.   Just good ol' fashion pizza with a thick crust.  Perk points for being open and deliver late night, which is definitely perfect when you want some pizza around that time. 
All the chain store pizza joints cannot beat this place.
author: Kris A.

description:
My family has been eating Bravo pizza for over 20 years and we've tried other places but have always gone back to Bravo's. Last year we vacationed in New York City and of course they're famous for Ray's Pizza. Supposedly it's the BEST pizza. When we compared the Ray's against Bravo's, we found no diifference. If anything, Ray's pizza is a thinner slice but was just as good as Bravo's.

If you're looking for gourmet style pizza, Bravo's is not the place for you. Their menu is kept simple and you don't have to worry about having a complex in deciding what to order. It's either pizza or choose from a small selection of their pastas and barbecue. I have had their bbcue chicken plate and it's huge. It's half a chicken w/pasta and vegetables enough for two people.

The only set back that comes to mind is that the parking is that great. You have to circle the block to find metered parking. The ambience is very homey and casual. It's definitely not a 5 star upscale type setting. Expect vinyl booths, mirrored pictures, frames of san francisco landmarks and an almost hole in the wall kind of feel. It's great though. They have excellent pizza and you don't wait long at all. Sometimes we'll call in and pick up and it's usually ready in 20 mins.
author: Faaae L.

description:
It doesn't quite stack up with Za Pizza but it was quite delicious. We had salami and mushroom with a pitcher of beer. Plus, you can't beat the neighborhoody, been-open-for-forever feel of the inside.

I will be back whenever Alfonso brings me back here! Until then if I am going to travel for pizza it will be to Za.
author: Stu M.

description:
We love this place and get delivery all the time...

Top five reasons why:
1. they have the delicious restaurant style ranch
2. the food always gets here before they say it will
3. dinners come with delicious side salad
4. dinners come with delicious (has to be) home-baked bread
5. It's cash only, and aren't those places always better?
author: Allie R.

description: Well when I first laid eyes on a Bravo pizza, I thought to myself, "What is this sparsely topped pizza with only 8 pieces of pepperoni and a sprinkling of sausage? Lame." But then I took a bite and found out that they were playing hide-the-salami with me. (I think that phrase comes up way too often in my day-to-day life.) The pizza ended up being pretty good actually, covered with a ton of meat-obscuring cheese. The crust was a bit thick for my tastes, but had good flavor nevertheless. This could become a go-to delivery spot for me.
author: Amy C.

description:
I used to live in Daly city, and for years my family ordered and went to this place.  I ended up moving across the bay and I was so bummed that I could go as often as we'd had in the past. 

Although I haven't visited there in the last year, I have to say that my brother still goes and he brought over a pie for us one evening and it's still the same, just as yummy as I remember it! 

This is a good place to go if you're out late one night or if you're in a hurry and you don't feel like cooking.
author: Gloria G.

description: Too bad they don't have the 1/2 price specials anymore.  Their pastas are so good.  That bread is to die for.  I recommend the Judy special... I think thats what is called, with the sauages... Way to go Bravo !
author: Jeff H.

description: YUM. ordered from this place last night. the crust was thick and delicious, the the pizzas were smothered in cheese. the 'pesto pesto' pie was awesome -- uber-garlicky and absolutely delicious. (pesto, feta, and garlic -- what more can you ask for?)
author: Elle B.

description: I finally got some pizza last week. Not as good as it used to be. Ordered a thick crust as I had many times in the past, and was not as I expected. The cheese was not as stretchy as I remembered it to be, and the toppings were less than before. It was o.k.  I asked my son what he thought of it, thinking he would say "not as good as it used to be", but he said it was the same. I am pretty picky, and I know there were some changes made to the way they make their pizza's now. But as long as my boy keeps liking it, I will go when he requests their pizza.
author: see y.

description: I'm not much of a pizza fan - I OD'ed in college, but I just moved to the neighborhood and was searching for a good pizza place nearby so the family could be happy. It was a toss up between Bravo's and another neighboring Pizza joint - and I am so happy we chose Bravo's. I have not had pizza this good since my high school days (25 years ago). Everyone was so happy with this pizza. why go anywhere else? I actually had to call the guy back and let him know how delicious it was. I guess for the people who want a thinner pizza - this isn't the place. This is just good hearty yummy pizza.
author: Mary M.

description: I've been eating at this place since I was a little kid and it never fails to stop me in my tracks when I bite into my slice. It's like falling in love all over again. The cheese is definitely thick and has elasticity in its own way but good. The breading and crust is what makes or breaks a pizza for me and this is just the right size; crunchy, thick, yet soft is what this place gives you. The sauce has an original taste to it. Hands down the best pizza in SF.
author: Fabio G.

description: We ordered for take out from Bravo Pizza. The parking was a bit tough, so next time I will have them deliver. The pizza had thick crust and lots of toppings. The sauce and ingredients were ok.  It is not my favorite pizza but I would order it again.
author: David L.

description: Bummer pizza. Doughy thick slices, didn't seem to have the toppings we ordered. Won't make that mistake again.
author: Lorrie G.

description: Growing-up, this is where my siblings and I would order pizza from. I hardly eat pizza now....due to my unfortunate discovery of being lactose intolerant...but I will always vote Bravo Pizza as the best pizza in town!! All of the transplants who say "other" pizza places in The City are the best, need to trek out to the Outer Mission/Excelsior District to try Bravo's pizza!!!
author: Neni E.

description: Best place for pizza! Grew up eating at this place and it has never failed me! I always order the same; Large Pepperoni Pizza, Chef Salad w/o the bell peppers, 12 wings and garlic bread with cheese! Awesome place!
author: Pedro B.

description: Just decent pizza.  Nothing outstanding, nothing horrible.   Reliable and will get the job done, just don't expect anything like Amici's or Blondies or Nizarios, but better than average.  The did deliver three free cans of soda with a large pizza without me even asking for them or having a coupon, nice touch.
author: Big Toe ..

description: I love bravos pizza. I have been eating here for almost 10 years. Really thick crusts, great if you like that. Good for delivery since they have the easiest number to remember. Come on (415)585-8500. What I usually order is the pizza, but the chicken wings are good too. Its also got a good location right on the corner of Geneva and Mission. Sometimes the parking is difficult, and if you're just trying to pick up, watch out for the bus. Other than that. I really like Bravos pizza
author: Michelle V.

description:
I'm always in search of the best tasting pizza. I chose Bravo as it was within walking distance from my place so I though "sure let's give it a shot." My cousin and I sat ourselves and waited approximately 5-7 minutes for a server to bring us our menus; eventually we left our table and placed our order to go. 

I opened the box and the pizza looked inviting and I thought "wow this is gonna be good," well...the taste was about average there was really nothing spectacular about it. Based on taste I should have rated 3 stars, but the problem was that both my cousin and I ended up sick after eating Bravo! Diners beware.
author: Jamie S.

description: I've ordered pizza and other food items from Bravo and decided to order a pasta meal. So I ordered spaghetti with Pesto which I never tired before at Bravo. Delivery took 1 1/2 hour. Portion size was very large however I was very disappointed with the Pesto, it was like noodles with cream soup, very bland and no flavor of pesto. I could not eat it and went without dinner. Called Bravo back to complain and they offered me a small credit on my next order.
author: steve e.

description: I been ordering Bravo pizza for over 20 years... You can't lose... variety of toppings, gooey cheese, open for late night delivery and great authentic non-commercial taste! IF THE NINJA TURTLES LIVED IN SAN FRANCISCO THIS IS DEFINITELY WHERE THEY WOULD ORDER FROM!!!!
author: Andres G.

description: I've lived in excelsior most of my life!! So there is not that many great restaurants but bravo is by far the best pizza around! If you enjoy thin healthy non greasy pizza stay far away! This pizza has thick slices!! Its much better then roma and lil joes and much cheaper then north beach you also get free soda with your order which the BF loves he lives off coke eww!! They do get busy I have waited more then an hour but I'm not complaining. This pizza has gotten me through break ups ladies you know what I'm talking about pizza sad love movies and lots of tissue!!!So thanks bravo!
author: Sabrina M.

description: Wow!!! All I can say is that screw New York pizza....screw Chicago style pizza! Bravo Pizza is San Francisco style pizza. I ordered a large #1 last night while I studied for finals and I was in heaven!  Delivery took a while but boy was it worth it.  The pizza was huge and with lots of cheese! I asked for thick crust and that made it that much heartier.  Definitely recommend this place.
author: Bert Z.

description: I tried this for the first time last week as a to-go order. I'm not a thick crust pizza person at all, but if you are, I think you'll really like this pizza. I'm more of a thin crust guy, but regardless, the crust was tasty, there was a good sauce/cheese ratio and the toppings were good quality as well. i ordered a side salad and their blue cheese dressing tasted homemade to me. very good. they also threw in a few enormous pieces of delicious bread, which i also think was homemade, and a few sodas for free. plus, everyone was super friendly. the ambiance is definitely old school, but i think next time, i'll eat in and maybe try a pasta. these guys really seem like they aim to please.
author: Steve S.

description: My friends and I always get this pizza when we're hanging out drinking beers. Its good drunk food but my only complaint would be that they put onions on the bottom of the cheese and I don't like onions. Other then that their pizza is pretty good and a decent price and is delivered quick. I should also add that their ranch is delicious...if you like ranch sauce with your pizza then make sure you order some from Bravos.
author: Shirley E.

description:
best pizza ive tried so far!! 
i recently decided to broaden my horizons and try the MINI PLATE of spaghetti with meatballs and a side order of garlic bread. holy hell...it's so good even for a simple plate! the mini plate can feed two people since their servings are huge...i recently popped my friend's Bravo Pizza cherry and i think i converted him =] 
the energy in this place is always really great! they stay open for dayyyysss because people from the city know this is the spot to be at!  the waiters are extremely nice, he once even gave me free garlic bread because he had forgotten to place my actual order in! LOVE LOVE LOVE. definitely must go, even for midnight cravings =]

only downside is delivery time...they take about an hour only because theyre really popular..even deliver to daly city!! pick-up orders dont take as long. enjoy!!
author: Natalie F.

description: This place has the best pizza!!!! I've been eating at this place forever!! Not only do they have great pizza but you can't go wrong with their entrees that are huge and come with mouth-watering warm bread!!!!
author: Cristina P.

description:
i've been ordering from bravo pizza since i've been in elementary school.  seriously.  

and what's great is that they send along a few cans of coke free with your pizza, depending on what size you get.  the two really just go together in perfect harmony.  

they only take cash which can suck when you ain't got none.
author: Kimby T.

description: Three and a half. Bravo is one of my favorite pizza places in San Francisco. The interior is very much like a sports bar. Families eat here while watching the games, and there may be a few slightly intoxicated dudes. Call ahead and pick up your pizza because the seating is limited to one bench, but you won't wait long because they whip up these pizzas in what seems like no time at all.
author: Evelyn B.

description: This has to be one of the best pizza places in the San Fran. Order your self either a small or a medium and you get coke. Now how cool is that. My favorite has to be cheese and add the hot pepper flakes. It is on and crackin'. If I want toppings, usually I get bell peppers and onions; and that's all I need. Everyone should try Bravo's at least once, you only have this lifetime.
author: Baseemah R.

description:
I was craving Krispy Kreme donuts, but since they don't deliver late at night, my next craving was pizza. Bravo was around the area and it was like a dream come true when I called at about 11pm and they said they will deliver! I ordered the small almost everything pizza, and it probably arrived almost an hour later. That was fine, since I was in no hurry. The delivery guy seemed to be super nice (he was an older man). 

They charge $2 for delivery, but be sure to tip the man on top of that =) It came with a free can of coca cola as well.

My first thought when I opened up the box was "YES, its a very CHEESY pizza". And I was right. Mounds of cheese came ripping apart, but not all the way when I pulled. The one bad thing about this pizza is that the toppings along with the mounds of cheese separates from the actual dough/base of the pizza, which can be annoying. I didn't have that problem when I ate it cold the next morning though. I thought that for a pizza called ALMOST EVERYTHING, it didn't have much but pepperoni, salami, olives and onions on top. But I was wrong. The pizza was made with marinara sauce (a very specific taste b/c they added a touch of something), then topped with a coat of cheese, stuffed with bell peppers, mushrooms that looked hidden BECAUSE there was another THICK layer of cheese on top of that! That was why I didn't see the GREENS! I don't know if that's how they make it, or they were trying to be lazy and quick. But either way, it wasn't bad pizza. I'd definitely order TO GO from them again, especially if its late at night.
author: Elaine H.

description: This place was highly recommended from a Bay Area transplant. It was tasty but my Homie didn't like that there were onions on the pizza. "F#$^&* Onions!!" I would go back for mas. The waiter service was great. I still think it ain't got nada on Roma's in Sacra!!!!
author: Michael G.

description: One of my fav places to eat pizza.  The crust is a little doughy but yet perfectly cooked....not chewy.  The over all taste of the pizza here is really good.  We are pizza fans and I can't find a place that has a really good flavor.  The crust the sauce the cheese the meat it is all just fresh flavorful.  Lasagna....hmm...hmmm...hmmm....one of my kids favorite and the portion...whoa!  I always have the baked chicken...not the best but good enough for me to want to have a plate of it while my kids are enjoying their slice of pizza.  The atmosphere is low key.  Always have a game going on tv and the service from the same lady there makes you feel right at home.  Take out is just as good and I love that they send you some free cokes....no need to go to the store!
author: lori c.

description: Pete (the owner) is wonderful!  Very cool guy...this spot is kinda small for the amount of business they get...so don't be offended if they try to push you out right after you are done eating...but the food and service is great.
author: Cris T.

description: I've been coming here my entire life.  This is one of the better pizza places in town.  The price is little high for pizza, but well worth it.  The extra large pizza can feed like 6 grown men, and there still will be leftovers.  The menu is also good.  Their pasta dishes are great, the meatballs are like the size of a aveage man's fist.  Everything is freshly made, even the dough for the pizza is.  The portortions are hugh, their salads will fill you up.  Man, I'll always come to Bravo's, till the day I die.
author: Marciano P.

description: This place and Little Joe's are the only pizza places in the neighborhood that still hasn't changed their recipe over the years. As long as they keep it up, they will always have a loyal customer; 20 years and counting. If you want something a little more cheesy, go to Bravos. If you want something with a thinner crust, go to Little Joe's. Either way, they're both outstanding. Although, I'd give the edge to Bravos because it's slightly cheaper.
author: Conrad C.

description: there are a lots of good pizza places in my neighborhood but this one definitely takes the cake...it's been my all time favorite going up and they have not changed anything since...I would have to say the best in San Francisco hands down.
author: chris s.

description: I was recently intro'd to Bravo;s. While it's probably not the best pizza in the world, it is pretty damn good. If at all possible, eat at the restaurant don't get it delivered, cuz it's the best straight from the oven. Plus, the waitresses and family ambiance of the place makes eating their fun and comfy. Some drawbacks include difficult parking, and the fact that they only take cash, both in the restaurant and for delivery. I've had a couple of their pasta dishes and enjoyed them as well.
author: Sierra S.

description: This Is My Absolute Favorite Pizza Place In The City. They Have The Best Pizza Sauce Ever. It's Nice And Garlicky And The Crust Is Incredible. They Have Other Great Food Also, But You Got To Have The Pizza.
author: Kameelah R.

description: I've been coming here for years! Great pizza.  You also get free soda.  Cons; cash only
author: Jerome H.

description: This is solid pizza.  Solid = heavy-duty thick crust, chunky sauce (just the right balance of tomato, garlic and spice), plentiful toppings, friendly delivery staff.  It's the style of pizza that cures a hangover (or at least it did for me - man, I was hurtin'!).   I had the Romano special and it did the trick.  Sort of weird that it comes with free Cokes (I don't drink soda), but that's obviously a popular extra touch, so now I have 3 cokes in my fridge that I'll never drink.  Will definitely order again and maybe even venture into the Excelsior to try it in person.  Bravo!
author: Julie L.

description: 2nd best pizza in Excelsior, just barely losing out to Roma down the street. Their pasta and soups are pretty good too, and the ambience is marginally nicer than Roma.
author: Brian H.

description:
i've been going/ordering here for years...ever since the tiny days of grade school, where this pizza joint was just a couple blocks away.  i've been here on dates, with friends, and have ordered for delivery.  great family who owns this place...very nice and friendly when you eat in.  the garlic bread is a honkin' huge loaf, and even better w/cheese.  mmm...  pizza is good, not gourmet to say the least, but just good pizza.  i prefer thin crust, and if u do, specify that because they do make very thick crust otherwise.  who else delivers in the wee hours of the night, excpet for mr. pizza man, so bravo's is a great alternative.  plus they give you cans and even litters of soda depending on how big your order is.  too bad i'm not a soda drinker...

cash only!
author: Sheri N.

description: The best late night pizza money can buy. Its 2am I just left the and my natives are starving and we had to figure out what to eat.  Everyone was sick of thai food and Denny's so we found pizza way out in the mission not Cable Car not even Blondie's but Bravo Pizza and it was great! The sauce was full of flavor and the topping just made it exciting. We had a small cheese and a small ground beef w/ onions and bell peppers and it was extremely tasty I was suprised a how much the ladies ate that night I think we ordered a third pizza or garlic bread.
author: Karim R.

description: I have been going to this place since i was about 10 years old. They pizza is great the people are nice.  If you are looking for the Italian pizza old school pizza this is the place for you.
author: Dee Z.

description: I can't believe that in all my years living in the city I've never been here, even though at one point I lived up the block. I came here with a friend last night, and it was a nice experience. The place seems a bit run down, but I think it contributes to the charm... like an old school pizza joint. This place is open late, the service is wonderful, and the pizza is good (their small sized pizza is perfect for two people)! I want to go here again and try more things... loved it!
author: Caroline L.

description: a childhood favorite of mine.  i come back regularly and often take my out of town friends here.  this place is full of nostalgia and i love eating here.  always get my usual almost everything special as its always on point.  love this place and they are open late night on weekends too.
author: Chris A.

description:
Not my kind of Pizza. 

They make Chicago deep dish pizza where all the toppings are piled underneath the cheese. I had ordered a vegetarian pizza and the moisture from the vegetables and tomato sauce made the pizza soo soggy that the bottom of the box was soggy too. The crust was thick and flavorless.

It is HEAVY and OILY and Soggy.
author: y h.

description: Best Pizza in San Francisco! The lasagna is good, and I love the garlic cheese bread!!! Hmmm. The only knock I have against this place is the dining experience.  I like the old tavern style of the place, but I think it's just an old tavern. LoL I don't understand why they can install new booths with cushion??? However, when you start to eat you forget about the lack of cushion.
author: Robert Q.

description: Nice pizza here. I can't believe it took me over 21 years to just finally try it! And I lived so close by!! Shame on me, I know. I'd give this place a 5, but I called in a few times during their business hours and got NO ANSWER. And I kept checking the Yelp page for Bravo's and the business hours was correct so I had no idea WHY they weren't picking up their phone! I believe I called around 5:30pm on a Friday and I mean come on, it's a FRIDAY! Busy day! Was highly disappointed that no one answered because I wanted to order for pick up. I ended up going to Irving Cafe to eat and I passed by Bravo's and it appeared no one was inside when clearly they should have been open. No sign posted why they weren't there and open, nothing at all. The time I did try the pizza however, that was awesome. Ordered there "Almost Everything" which was a great pizza and made me regret why it took me so many years just to finally try the place.
author: Elton N.

description: Last nite was pizza nite.  I decided to place the delivery order while my Xo worked out at the gym.  I ordered our usual medium pizza with chicken, garlic & mushrooms (our favorite toppings).  The pizza dough is thick, the red sauce is enough for the flavor & the cheese is alot so you dont have to order extra cheese. I decided to try the chicken scallopini which consisted of slices of chicken & mushrooms over fettucine noodles with wine sauce.  The mushrooms are indeed huge!  The taste was fairly bland so I had to add the parmesan cheese that they gave us.  On top of all our order, we got 2 cans of coke for free. The only thing that I dont like from ordering here is that it's CASH ONLY!  Therefore, minus 1 star.
author: XoXo X.

description:
only one star for complementary coke.
But I would much rather not have the coke and have a decent pizza.
I ordered a medium garlic chicken pizza and 12pc hot wings. I paid about 28 dollars and the food was totally not worth the price! It took them 1hour and 20 minutes to deliver the pizza.  I don't mind waiting that long if the pizza was good since they did tell me ahead of time that it would take about 1 hour. 
the dough was dry and thick what made it worst is that there was barely any sauce. it was like cardboard! the chicken pieces was extremely dry and to the point where some pieces were hard as a rock! The sauce for the hot wings was ok, but the wings itself was so dry! Everything was like they cooked it for an hour and dried everything up. Please avoid this place!
author: Ettolrahc M.

description: The most excellent Pizza every. Everytime I visit my parents and friends in San Francisco I eat there. IT is simply good.
author: Alexander M.

description: This neighborhood has a LOT of pizza places (5 within 2 blocks of my house) but Bravo's is my favorite. By far the best pizza in the vicinity. It's better when eaten in the restaurant as opposed to delivery.
author: K M.

description:
This place is divy and dope at the same time.  Pizza is good to great depending on the visit but the big upside is the family size salad with the pizza.  Serious munchers only need apply.  Chewy dough?  Man i've been to New York and Chicago and well,  that's just different, good pizza.  Bravo serves classic SF pizza, if there is such a thing, with the avergae joe (or Jose) in  mind.  The only bad thing????The restrooms.  Wow, someone whould blow them, up and build them over.

slickleo
author: Leo H.

description: My grandmother introduced me to this pizzeria almost 25 years ago and she got me hooked. Now I take my husband, daughter, niece and nephew. This is the BEST pizza I have tried in California.  I know it may not measure up to Chicago style or New York Pizza, but we are not there and they are not in here and until I go to Chicago or New York to try a slice and judge for myself, Bravo Will be the Best of the Best in my heart because I HEART BRAVO PIZZA.
author: Diana V.

description: Great pizza - loads of cheese and meats and they threw in sodas as well on a pickup order.  They even gave my two little kids money for the gum ball machine.   If you like your pizza thin crust NY style this probably isn't your cup of tea but if you like pizza that's more substantial then I'd definitely check this place out.
author: Michael M.

description: My #1 pick for pizza!! love this place. They use the best cheese of top you can tell they use only the best to make your food. I've dined in and had delivery both good and their drivers are all very friendly. Recommend this place to everyone. My friend showed me this place and fell in love with their pizza so I introduced it to my husband and he loved it too!!
author: Qita A.

description: my favorite pizza place.  bravo serves straight old school thick crust, lotsa cheese, lotsa topping, calorie filled, heart attack in a pan-pizza.  none of that bobby brown round table taste like cardboard pizza.  they have other pasta dishes and entrees, but go for the meat special - pepperoni, salami, sausage, ham, and linguica.
author: Ray R.

description: another place that the ex loved, but this one was a GREAT choice. the pizza was very CHEESY and tasty. and they always threw in a couple cans of coke for free! and the price was really cheap. the delivery guys were also actually friendly! i'll miss this place so im not in that area anymore, but whenever i go to the geneva area, i'll be sure to grab lunch here!
author: Andrew T.

description: This place is nothing special.  It was really greasy and cardboard-esque.  However, it does taste better when reheated in a toaster oven later.
author: John D.

description: They had very few toppings options.  There was not enough sauce on the pizza.  They dough was okay, but not phenomenal.  My husband ordered a pasta.  The flavor was "okay."  It was a nice sized portion.  The delivery was timely.  I've ordered from there twice, and probably won't again.  I think I'd be better off ordering from a chain.
author: Chastidy R.

description: writing a review on pizza is sooo cliche~but this spot will compete with northbeach pizza (SAME ST)...this place is soooo old school & tastes authentic~u get free cokes with a large order of pizza~the chef salad here is huuuuge...only minor uncool thing about this is that they dont take credit cards lol~atm inside...its the beef/shroom for me~wouldnt attempt eating the other italian grub here...this review jus based on the pizza
author: elmer d.

description: the first time i ate here was on my way back from baker beach with a couple of my buddies. since we were a bit low on money(why would we even think about bringing money to the beach anyways???) we shared an XL pizza for 4 people. i wouldn't imagine being so full after a couple of slices but yes it was tasty. the pineapple(my fave) and cheeeessyy goodness went well with the ocean water that i almost drowned in =) BUT!! i still like blondie's pizza better :3
author: Amalia D.

description: I was dubious when I saw it from the outside but the smell that hits you when you walk in the door makes you feel oh so good.  Very friendly staff hit you at the door, then you're escorted over to a very worn out red pleather booth, 'old shool' yes, me happy.  While the thin crust pizza wasn't all that (hey I just moved from Brooklyn) great it was good enough when combined with the pizza joint atmosphere and the inexpensive red wine.
author: warren a.

description: Last night at 7:00 my husband told me we were having someone over for dinner at 7:30. I'd seen the scenario on an episode of Bewitched, but I don't have Samantha's powers. Being new to the neighborhood, we knew who to turn to for delivery --  Yelp. Bravo was better than your average delivered pizza and reminded me that this neighborhood was once Italian. We called at 7:30 and they delivered in 40 minutes.
author: tracie h.

description: ASSholes running this place.  I call to see if they deliver and the man says yes..... asks me my address and then proceeds to tell me I live by fishermans warf. I don't live by there I live in upper haight.  When I try to tell him that he changes his mind and tells me that they don't deliver at all.  Either this guy is a total idiot or they actually don't deliver, I'm not sure.  No matter how good the pizza is the customer service sucks a fat one!!
author: o g.
